persorbeo: <entryFree id="n35546" type="main" key="persorbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sorbĕo</orth>, <itype>bui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drink up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to absorb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongiae persorbentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perspecte: <entryFree id="n35547" type="main" key="perspecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perspicio, <sense id="n35547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perspectio: <entryFree id="n35548" type="main" key="perspecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perspicio</etym>, <sense id="n35548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeing into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perception</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum caelestium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; id. Ira Dei, 1, 4: veritatis, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 4.</sense></entryFree>
perspecto: <entryFree id="n35549" type="main" key="perspecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n35549.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behold to the end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquennale certamen gymnicum perspectavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35549.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look all about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiose perspecta aedis, ut lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspector: <entryFree id="n35550" type="main" key="perspector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who understands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a discerner</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mentis perspector Jesus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 275</bibl></cit> (al. prospector).</sense></entryFree>
perspectus: <entryFree id="n35551" type="main" key="perspectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perspicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35552" type="main" key="perspectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perspicio</etym>, <sense id="n35552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a viewing thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inspection</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 484</bibl> (al. prospectus).</sense></entryFree>
perspeculor: <entryFree id="n35553" type="main" key="perspe^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-spĕcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n35553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to examine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">explore thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reconnoitre well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspeculatus locorum situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>: cum de vallo perspecularetur, Auct. B. Afr. 31.</sense></entryFree>
perspergo: <entryFree id="n35554" type="main" key="perspergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-spargo</etym>, <sense id="n35554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35554.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna amureā crudā perspergito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde haustā aquā templum deae perspersum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prusiadem urbem perspergit Hylas lacus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 42, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35554.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem tamquam sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspicabilis: <entryFree id="n35555" type="main" key="perspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perspicio</etym>, <sense id="n35555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may easily be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 32" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 32</bibl> ad Paul.</sense></entryFree>
perspicace: <entryFree id="n35556" type="main" key="perspi^ca_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcācē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharp-sightedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>: quam perspicace, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 19</bibl>, and 515, 31 (Com. Rel. v. 59 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
perspicacitas: <entryFree id="n35557" type="main" key="perspi^ca_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perspicax</etym>, <sense id="n35557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharp-sightedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discrimination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nullā perspicacitate, sine innocentium sontiumque differentiā,...damnarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: perspicacitas, <foreign lang="greek">to\ sunoptiko/n</foreign>, Gloss. Lab.</sense></entryFree>
perspicaciter: <entryFree id="n35558" type="main" key="perspi^ca_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perspicax <sense id="n35558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perspicax: <entryFree id="n35559" type="main" key="perspi^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perspicio</etym>, <sense id="n35559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharp -sighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicacious</hi>: perspicax prudentia, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo (with astutus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequemur et id, quod acutum et perspicax naturā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales oculis perspicax, unguibus pertinax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Soc. p. 108</bibl></cit> Hildebr.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo perspicacior Lynceo vel Argo et oculus totus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp-sightedly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 1, 38</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: perspicacius, Consol. Phil. 3 Boëth.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Metr. 11, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perspicibilis: <entryFree id="n35560" type="main" key="perspi^ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be clearly seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis splendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspicientia: <entryFree id="n35561" type="main" key="perspi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a full perception</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspicio: <entryFree id="n35562" type="main" key="perspi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">see through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look at.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35562.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non modo non intrari, sed ne perspici quidem posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: eas (epistulas) ego oportet perspiciam, corrigam: tum denique edentur, <hi rend="ital">to look</hi> <cb n="PERS" /> <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">read through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut prae densitate arborum perspici caelum vix posset,</quote> <trans><tr>to look at the sky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35562.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to look closely at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis perspiciendi causā venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimis id granis constat, ut vix perspici quaedam possint,</quote> <trans><tr>are scarcely visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 71</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicito prius, quid intus agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35562.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertain</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se ipse perspexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu perspice rem et pertenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 318</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, quaeso, perspicite atque cognoscite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid conjecturā,</quote> <trans><tr>to guess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus virtutem hostes, misericordiam victi, fidem ceteri perspexerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nollem accidisset tempus, in quo perspicere posses, quanti te facerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam saepe in parvā pecuniā perspiciuntur, quam sint leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpaucos, quorum in se fidem perspexerat, relinquere in Galliā decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbitis et non perspicietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 28, 26</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicio nihili meam vos facere gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspiciebant enim in Hortensii sententiam multis partibus plures ituros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">clearly perceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars rebus cognitis penitusque perspectis continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus alicujus experta atque perspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentia mihi perspectissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-spectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intelligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut docte et perspecte sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspicue: <entryFree id="n35563" type="main" key="perspi^cu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perspicuus <sense id="n35563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perspicuitas: <entryFree id="n35564" type="main" key="perspi^cu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perspicuus</etym>, <sense id="n35564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transparency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35564.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrea perspicuitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 20, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35564.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">evidentness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuity</hi>: nihil est clarius <foreign lang="greek">e)nargei/a</foreign>, perspicuitatem, aut evidentiam nos, si placet, nominemus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuitas argumentatione elevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuitas in verbis praecipuam habet proprietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspicuus: <entryFree id="n35565" type="main" key="perspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perspĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perspicio</etym>, <sense id="n35565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (syn. tralucidus). </sense><sense id="n35565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:86:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 86, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:68:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 68, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>crystals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 94</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35565.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuous</hi> (very freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. evidens): quasi vero hoc perspicuum sit constetque inter omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potest esse tam apertum, tamque perspicuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adultera tenui veste perspicua,</quote> <trans><tr>known by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuum est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-spĭcŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">evidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane et perspicue expedire aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte et perspicue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicue falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilucide atque perspicue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 274</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perspiro: <entryFree id="n35566" type="main" key="perspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-spīro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n35566.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe everywhere</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35566.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To blow constantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti perspirantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persterno: <entryFree id="n35567" type="main" key="persterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pave all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make quite even</hi> or <hi rend="ital">level</hi>: viam, Liv 10, 47, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perstillo: <entryFree id="n35568" type="main" key="perstillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perstillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta jugiter perstillantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 19, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perstimulo: <entryFree id="n35569" type="main" key="persti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-stĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stimulate violently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
perstipo: <entryFree id="n35570" type="main" key="persti_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-stīpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crowd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persto: <entryFree id="n35571" type="main" key="persto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stātum</itype> (<sense id="n35571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part.</hi> perstaturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34, 4</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stand firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue standing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">frenatis equis equites diem totum perstabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus a mane usque ad horam X. diei perstiterunt, Auct. B Afr. 61 in limine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:71" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35571.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remain steadfast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: nihil est toto quod perstet in orbe: cuncta <pb n="1357" /> <cb n="PERS" /> fluunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea flaminibus, quae toto perstitit anno, Tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35571.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stand fast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persist</hi> in any thing (class.; syn.: persevero, permaneo); usually constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant posse, et in eo perstant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pravitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in impudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 52, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 6</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 8, 34, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 13, 10: in pertinaci simulatione inopiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iisdem dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:143" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 143</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in decreto perstaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si perstaretur in bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimates in Romanā societate perstandum censebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35571.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quoque mens eadem perstat mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia perstabat memorans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persta atque obdura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perstitit Narcissus,</quote> <trans><tr>persisted in his determination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35571.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pertinacissimus fueris, si perstiteris ad corpus ea, quae dixi, referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc. 3 (B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. perstiteris in eo): persto condere semen humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perstas non cedere terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:58" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 38, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perstratus: <entryFree id="n35572" type="main" key="perstra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perstrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from persterno.</entryFree>
perstrepo: <entryFree id="n35573" type="main" key="perstre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-strĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n35573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make much noise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n35573.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a great noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeunt lavatum, perstrepunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus perstrepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:430" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perstrepit rumor in aulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clangor buccinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 19, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35573.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35573.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sound through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a noise through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba perstrepit aedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 213</bibl></cit>: cubiculum jubilis suis, M. Aur. ap. Front. Ep. ad M. Caesarem, 4, 5 Mai.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore januas perstrepi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35573.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make a great noise with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi> any thing: nonne haec cotidie perstrepunt Ariani? Ambros. de Fide, 5, 16, 19.</sense></entryFree>
perstrictio: <entryFree id="n35574" type="main" key="perstricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perstrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perstringo</etym>, <sense id="n35574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friction</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 35</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35574.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a verbal attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de perstrictione diversae partis nihil cavetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perstrictus: <entryFree id="n35575" type="main" key="perstrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perstringo.</entryFree>
perstrido: <entryFree id="n35576" type="main" key="perstri_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-strīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whistle through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perstridunt caerula (maria) venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Arat. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perstringo: <entryFree id="n35577" type="main" key="perstringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-stringo</orth>, <itype>nxi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35577.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind tightly together; to draw together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus nimio rigore perstrictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 296</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35577.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To graze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graze against</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n35577.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum aratro,</quote> <trans><tr>to plough slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portam vomere,</quote> <trans><tr>to graze against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 40</bibl></cit> dub. (al. praestr-).—</sense><sense id="n35577.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">To blunt</hi> by grazing against, <hi rend="ital">to make dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dull</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minaci murmure aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to stun</tr>, <tr>deafen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem multo perstringunt lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:666" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 666</bibl></cit> (but for perstringere oculos, aciem, etc., cf. praestringo).—</sense><sense id="n35577.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35577.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror ingens spectantes perstringit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:81" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 81</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:194" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 194</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35577.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35577.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wound slightly</hi> with words; <hi rend="ital">to blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprimand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprove</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus voluntatem asperioribus facetiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vocis libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suspicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem oblique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultum habitumque alicujus lenibus verbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice perstricti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perstringendos mulcendosque militum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35577.8" n="b" level="4"> In speaking, <hi rend="ital">to touch slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glance over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to narrate briefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter transire ac tantummodo perstringere unamquamque rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod meis omnibus litteris in Pompeianā laude perstrictus est (Crassus),</quote> <trans><tr>belittled</tr>, <tr>slighted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam breviter perstringere atque attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter perstringere reliquum vitae cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perstruo: <entryFree id="n35578" type="main" key="perstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem in altitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35578.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: falsitatem, Hilar. Op Hist. Fragm. 2, 30. <cb n="PERS" /></sense></entryFree>
perstudiose: <entryFree id="n35579" type="main" key="perstu^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perstŭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perstudiosus <sense id="n35579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perstudiosus: <entryFree id="n35580" type="main" key="perstu^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-stŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very desirous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fond</hi> of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">musicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum Graecarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perstŭdĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fondly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:207" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 56, 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persuadeo: <entryFree id="n35581" type="main" key="persua_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-suādĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring over by talking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to convince</hi> of the truth of any thing, <hi rend="ital">to persuade</hi> (cf. convinco). </sense><sense id="n35581.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> and <case>dat.</case>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris officium est dicere ad persuadendum accommodate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprimis hoc volunt persuadere, non interire animas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim tibi ita persuadeas, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cum mihi non modo confirmasset, sed etiam persuasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne si forte de paupertate non persuaseris, sit aegritudini concedendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:27:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 27, 59</bibl></cit>; Hor S. 1, 6, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 315</bibl>: quis te persuasit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 10</bibl> (p. 175, n. 4 Vahl.).—<hi rend="ital">Pass. pers.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum animus auditoris persuasus esse videtur ab eis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si persuasus auditor fuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl></cit>, § 10: si scit et persuasus est, quid irascitur, etc., Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrupti sunt quibus persuasum sit foedissimum hostem justissimo bello prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi persuaderi numquam potuit, animos ... vivere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 22, 80</bibl></cit>. persuasum habere, v. <pos>P. a.</pos> infra.—</sense><sense id="n35581.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade</hi> to do any thing (class.); usually constr. with <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ne;</hi> rarely (and post-Aug.) <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasit nox, amor, adulescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuebat ne sibi persuaderes, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic magnis praemiis pollicitationibusque persuadent, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic Albinus persuadet, regnum ab senatu petat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo sunt tempora, quibus aliquid contra Caesarem Pompeio suaserim, unum, ne, etc.... alterum ne, etc.... quorum si utrumvis persuasissem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tamen haec felicitas illi persuasit neglegentiam,</quote> <trans><tr>led him into negligence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Contr. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia nobis mala solitudo persuadet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 25:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasit ei tyrannidis finem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec arare terram aut expectare annum tam facile persuaseris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Romanis primus persuaserit navem conscendere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidāque etiam hibernis algoribus persuasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquā die te persuadeam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his persuaderi, ut, etc., non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasum est facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi quidquam persuaderi potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi persuasum habere, for sibi persuaderi: ea loca provinciae adjungere sibi persuasum habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; v. Zumpt, Gr. § 407, n. 1; § 634.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">persuāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established, <hi rend="ital">settled.</hi>—Sup.</hi>: quod mihi persuasissimum est, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 9, 2</bibl>.—Esp., in phrase persuasum habere, <hi rend="ital">to be convinced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard as settled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia persuasum habuerunt, animas hominum immortalis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: comperi persuasissimum habuisse eum, with <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nos e diverso fumi amaritudine vetustatem indui persuasum habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasum habeo posse fieri ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:3 al" default="NO">4, 3, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
persuasibilis: <entryFree id="n35582" type="main" key="persua_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persuāsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>persuadeo</etym>, <sense id="n35582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">convincing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasive</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorice est vis inveniendi omnia in oratione persuasibilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanae sapientiae verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 65, 9</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasibile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>, §§ 16 and 21.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">persuā-sĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">convincingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasively</hi>: dicere, Cels. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:22" default="NO">22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persuasio: <entryFree id="n35583" type="main" key="persua_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persuāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n35583.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a convincing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere apposite ad persuasionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35583.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">conviction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">falsam sibi scientiae persuasionem induerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogans de se persuasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasionis plenus cuncta fato agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasio est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is a prevalent opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 39</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PERT" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">115: persuasio durat in magnā parte vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persuasor: <entryFree id="n35584" type="main" key="persua_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persuāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>persuadeo</etym>, <sense id="n35584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a convincer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who persuades</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prevails upon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 467</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persuastrix: <entryFree id="n35585" type="main" key="persuastrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persuastrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-itrix</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>persuasor</etym>, <sense id="n35585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that persuades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">female</hi>) <hi rend="ital">persuader.</hi> probripellecebrae et persuastrices, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 47</bibl>.—Collat. form persuasitrices, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persuasus: <entryFree id="n35586" type="main" key="persua_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persuāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. persuadeo <sense id="n35586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35587" type="main" key="persua_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persuāsus</orth>, <itype>ŭs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>persuadeo</etym>, <sense id="n35587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a persuading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasu servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:Argum. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. Argum. 1</bibl></cit>: hujus persuasu et inductu, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persuavis: <entryFree id="n35588" type="main" key="persua_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-suāvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sweet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:30" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 30</bibl></cit> Mai.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">persuā-vĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very pleasantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Music. 4:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Music. 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
persubtilis: <entryFree id="n35589" type="main" key="persubti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-subtīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n35589.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very fine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very subtle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus persubtilis atque minutis Perquam corporibus factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35589.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very ingenious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persulco: <entryFree id="n35590" type="main" key="persulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sulco</orth>, no <sense id="n35590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to furrow through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plough up.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugis persulcata genas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
persultator: <entryFree id="n35591" type="main" key="persulta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">persultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>persulto</etym>, <sense id="n35591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skips about</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:23" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 23</bibl></cit> (22).</sense></entryFree>
persulto: <entryFree id="n35592" type="main" key="persulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sulto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>salto</etym>, <sense id="n35592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skip</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">prance about</hi> in a place (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n35592.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35592.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo stabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notis vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super durata glacie stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35592.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skip through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frisk about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">range about</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes persultant pabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captam Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria (Tritonum catervae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35592.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the voice. </sense><sense id="n35592.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox persultat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 10 praef.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n35592.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to command imperiously</hi>: haec persultanti, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 77.</sense></entryFree>
persuo: <entryFree id="n35593" type="gloss" key="persu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-sŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sew through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sew up</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 136</bibl>: persuo, <foreign lang="greek">diarra/ptw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pertabesco: <entryFree id="n35594" type="main" key="perta_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tābesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be gradually consumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to waste away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 472</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertaedeo: <entryFree id="n35595" type="main" key="pertaede^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertaedĕo</orth>, v. pertaedet.</entryFree>
pertaedesco: <entryFree id="n35596" type="main" key="pertaedesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertaedesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pertaedet], <hi rend="ital">to become disgusted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearied</hi> with any thing (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne pertaedescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam omnes pertaeduissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertaedet: <entryFree id="n35597" type="main" key="pertaedet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-taedet</orth>, <itype>taesum est, 2</itype> (quidam pertisum volunt: <sense id="n35597.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quod consuetudo non probavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. pp. 216 sq.; 273, 8 Müll.; also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 18</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">to be disgusted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearied</hi> with any thing; <hi rend="ital">to feel disgust at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sick of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35597.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me sermonis pertaesum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem pertaesum est esse domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1061</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertaesum est enim (me) levitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertaesum est vos injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 8</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas uxores habuerat, quarum matrimonii pertaedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentitudinis eorum pertaesa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35597.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: usque adeo pertaesum vos mihi esse, Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 291</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n35597.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertaesus ignaviam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertaesus morum perversitatem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertaesus: <entryFree id="n35598" type="main" key="pertaesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertaesus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pertaedet.</entryFree>
pertango: <entryFree id="n35599" type="main" key="pertango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tango</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch all over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to baste well</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pullum suo sibi jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8" default="NO">8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertego: <entryFree id="n35600" type="main" key="perte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover all over</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n35600.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Odeum navium malis et antemnis e spoliis Persicis pertexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. pertexuit): <cit><quote lang="la">locus pertectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35600.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefacta benefactis pertegito, ne perpluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertemerarius: <entryFree id="n35601" type="main" key="perte^me^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕmĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very rash;</hi> in tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">cum perabsurdum perque temerarium sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertendo: <entryFree id="n35602" type="main" key="pertendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, and tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <gen>n.</gen>—Prop., to stretch out, extend <pb n="1358" /> <cb n="PERT" /> hence, transf., * <sense id="n35602.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go on with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">video non licere ut coeperam hoc pertendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35602.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35602.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to strive forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to push on</hi> to a place; hence, <hi rend="ital">to go right on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed to</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 11</bibl>, the correct reading is perpendemus): <cit><quote lang="la">pars maxima Romam pertenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertendit ad alteram ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl></cit>; id. Vit. Plin.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35602.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to keep on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum si incipies, neque pertendes naviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a qua re sit pertinacia quom quaeritur, ostenditur esse a pertendendo ... in quo non debet pertendi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 2</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl> (3, 7), 17.—</sense><sense id="n35602.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be attentive</hi> (late Lat.), Laurent. Hom. 1.</sense></entryFree>
perteneo: <entryFree id="n35603" type="main" key="perte^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold fast</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">utinam (me) pertinuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66</bibl></cit>, n. 13.</sense></entryFree>
pertento: <entryFree id="n35604" type="main" key="pertento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, to feel all over; hence, <sense id="n35604.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n35604.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum utrumque pugionem pertentasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl></cit>: alta bipenni latera, Petr. poët. 89, v. 24.— </sense><sense id="n35604.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum cohortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: rem, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weigh well</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia pertento, omnia experior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilium adulescentium animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35604.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pervade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invade; to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">dum prima lues ... Pertentat sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertentant gaudia pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremor pertentet Corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinolentiā ac fatigatione pertentatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertenuis: <entryFree id="n35605" type="main" key="perte^nu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕnŭis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35605.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabulum pertenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35605.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very slight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertepidus: <entryFree id="n35606" type="main" key="perte^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very lukewarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very tepid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 17, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perterebro: <entryFree id="n35607" type="main" key="perte^re^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕrĕbro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bore through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis perterebratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertergeo: <entryFree id="n35608" type="main" key="perterge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tergĕo</orth>, <itype>tersi, tersum, 2</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wipe off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wipe dry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35608.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausape purpureo mensam pertersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongia vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n35608.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">touch against gently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) quasi perterget pupillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 249</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lux oculos perterget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 277</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros oculos perterget longior aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertero: <entryFree id="n35609" type="main" key="perte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n35609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>trītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to rub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pound to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrti bacam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva pertrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perterrefacio: <entryFree id="n35610" type="main" key="perterre^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perterrĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perterreo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n35610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terrify thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Davum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perterrefactus: <entryFree id="n35611" type="main" key="perterre^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perterrĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perterrefacio.</entryFree>
perterreo: <entryFree id="n35612" type="main" key="perterre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terrify thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios magnitudine poenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu perterriti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstupefactus ac perterritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficii conscientiā perterritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa mea perterrita sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (but the true read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13, 37</bibl>, is proterritus).</sense></entryFree>
perterricrepus: <entryFree id="n35613" type="main" key="perterri^cre^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perterrĭcrĕpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perterreo-crepo</etym>, <sense id="n35613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that clatters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rattles most terribly</hi> (ante-class.); old poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perterrito: <entryFree id="n35614" type="main" key="perterri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perterrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>perterreo</etym>, <sense id="n35614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terrify thoroughly</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perterritus: <entryFree id="n35615" type="main" key="perterri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perterrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perterreo.</entryFree>
pertexo: <entryFree id="n35616" type="main" key="pertexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-texo</orth>, <itype>xui, xtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35616.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35616.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weave throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weave entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla bysso tenui pertexta, i. e. byssina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35616.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interweave</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">Odeum, quod Pericles navium malis et antennis pertexuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. pertexit).—</sense><sense id="n35616.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertexe modo quod exorsus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 145</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PERT" /></sense></entryFree>
pertextus: <entryFree id="n35617" type="main" key="pertextus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pertexo.</entryFree>
pertica: <entryFree id="n35618" type="main" key="perti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a long staff.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35618.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">perticam habere ... quī verberarem asinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertica suspensos portabat longa maniplos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:117" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nuc. 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perticis oleas decutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis perticis flagellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 298</bibl></cit>;
