<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perticae, quibus araneae deterguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertica quā stabuli fores oflirmari solebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 28, p. 200</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35618.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35618.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young tree;</hi> of willows, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35618.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A measuring-rod</hi>, with which the grants of land were measured out to the soldiers; <hi rend="ital">a pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perch</hi> (usually called decempeda): <cit><quote lang="la">abstulit excultas pertica tristis opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 130; Val. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Dir. 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. Ecl. 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35618.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a portion of land measured out with the</hi> pertica: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque coloniae est assignatum, id universum pertica appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. Agr. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. Agr. p. 43</bibl></cit> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n35618.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a measure.</hi>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non unā perticā, quod dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perticalis: <entryFree id="n35619" type="main" key="perti^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pertica</etym>, <sense id="n35619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for poles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:31:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perticarius: <entryFree id="n35620" type="gloss" key="perti^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to poles</hi>: negotians perticarius, Inscr. Marang. Delle Cose Gentil. p. 488.</sense></entryFree>
perticatus: <entryFree id="n35621" type="main" key="perti^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying a staff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertimefacio: <entryFree id="n35622" type="main" key="perti^me^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭmĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pertimeo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n35622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put in great fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten greatly</hi>: pertimefactus maerore animi, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 33</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 96 Rib.): te pertimefacto, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertimeo: <entryFree id="n35623" type="main" key="perti^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fear greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very timid</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pertimentes ullam perturbationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 3, 6 (al. praetim).</sense></entryFree>
pertimesco: <entryFree id="n35624" type="main" key="perti^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĭmesco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">to become very much frightened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be greatly afraid</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">to fear greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tantam religionem non pertimescebas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vero non mediocriter pertimesco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen imperii etiam in levi personā pertimescitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames esset pertimescenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non putavi famam inconstantiae mihi pertimescendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid peccasset, pertimescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:49:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 49, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illi umquam de se pertimescent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter de suis periculis fortunisque omnibus pertimescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 71</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertinacia: <entryFree id="n35625" type="main" key="perti^na_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭnācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pertinax</etym>, <sense id="n35625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perseverance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy</hi>, in a good sense; and (more freq.) in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertinacity</hi> (syn.: perseverantia, pervicacia): dicitur quom demonstratur in quo non debet pertendi et pertendit, pertinaciam esse; <cit><quote lang="la">in quo oportet manere, si in eo perstet, perseverantia sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 2</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unicuique virtuti finitimum vitium reperietur, ut pertinacia, quae perseverantiae finitima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>; v. Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 432, 32 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen instituit non pertinaciā et studio vincendi, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desistere pertinaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciae finem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebri pertinacia accendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciam alicujus vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—In a good sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientia et pertinacia hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in evitando inevitabili malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4</bibl></cit>, praef. 12: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorum pertinacia,</quote> <trans><tr>steadfast opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 13, § 52</bibl></cit>.—Personified, <hi rend="ital">the sister of Æther</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Dies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertinaciter: <entryFree id="n35626" type="main" key="perti^na_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭnācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pertinax <sense id="n35626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pertinax: <entryFree id="n35627" type="main" key="perti^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĭnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenax</etym>, <sense id="n35627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that holds fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that clings firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very tenacious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35627.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">digitus male pertinax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales unguibus pertinax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 366</bibl></cit>: tenaxne pater ejus est? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Pater immo edepol pertinax, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly avaricious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35627.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that lasts long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very durable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligo in Allobrogum agro pertinax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 8, 20, § 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35627.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertinacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stubborn</hi><cb n="PERT" />  (cf. pervicax); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; also (rare and not ante-Aug.) with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> also (post-Aug.) with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 433, 6 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concertationes in disputando pertinaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:27 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacissimus fueris, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde pertinax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinax fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 101, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium, Quint. Inst. prooem.: certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare pertinaci statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octoginta milia fortissimae pertinacissimaeque in retinendis armis juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinax virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinax adversus temerarios impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacior in repugnando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinax ad obtinendam injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quod coepit pertinax et intenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35627.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna ... Ludum insolentem ludere pertinax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35627.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 338, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭnācĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n35627.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Very fast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very tenaciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persistently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa magis pertinaciter haerent, quo deteriora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacius resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacissime retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 100</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35627.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perseveringly; obstinately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stubbornly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertinaciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciter liberalibus studiis deditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciter in aliquā re manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: pertinaciter offensus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacius insequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacissime pabulo abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35627.8" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pertĭnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">surname of the emperor P. Helvius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who succeeded Commodus on the throne</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 18" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertinenter: <entryFree id="n35628" type="main" key="perti^nenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭnenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pertineo <sense id="n35628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pertineo: <entryFree id="n35629" type="main" key="perti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>teneo</etym>, <sense id="n35629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend to</hi> a place; <hi rend="ital">to arrive at</hi> a place (class., esp. in the trop. signif.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">advv.;</hi> very rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">per</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. </sense><sense id="n35629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera arteria ad pulmones usque pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae in omnes partes corporis pertinentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus pertinens per naturam cujusque rei, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgae pertinent ad inferiorem partem fluminis Rheni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi, qui ad mare pertinebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (silvam) longe introrsus pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vastae magnitudinis urbe partium sensu non satis pertinente in omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>extending in all directions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ait praetor: pertinet, hoc significat: quod ex aedibus ejus in tuas pertinet, hoc est dirigitur, extenditur, pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35629.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35629.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (like <foreign lang="greek">dih/kein, kaqh/kein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">eadem bonitas etiam ad multitudinem pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas patriae per omnes ordines pertinebat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pervaded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad posteritatis memoriam pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina, quorum significatio ad totam vitam pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 47 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic pertinet a natali ad diem extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 12, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35629.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To belong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have reference to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">somnium ad aliquam rem pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa res ad meum officium pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ad patriciam Sulpiciorum familiam Quirinius pertinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec breviter attingemus, scrutati maxime pertinentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 341</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35629.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have a tendency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lead to</hi> an object or result, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quo pertineat, videte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem plures a nobis nominati sunt, eo pertinuit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:299" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 87, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa illuc pertinet, ut sciatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretando, quorsum quidque pertineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ista ad vidulum pertinent, servae sint istae an liberae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in phrase: quod ad aliquem (aliquid) pertinet, <hi rend="ital">as far as concerns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in regard to</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): quod ad inducias pertineret, sic belli rationem esse divisam, ut, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad nationes exteras pertinet, Cicero varie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad Dymnum pertinet, nihil scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: quod pertinet ad elephantos, id. <pb n="1359" /> <cb n="PERT" /> 9, 2, 19; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ad decernentes pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad me pertinet, intellego me perdidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 119, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:1" default="NO">7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virtutibus tum etiam fortuna, siquid hoc ad rem pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus quidque se attingat ad seque pertineat perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud dissimulas ad te quod pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:10:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35629.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be applicable to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be suitable to</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">magis pol haec malitia pertinet ad viros, quam ad mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem suspicio maleficii pertineat,</quote> <trans><tr>on whom suspicion should fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad officium meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas ad rem familiarem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad imperatorem prodigium pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35629.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To belong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be the right of</hi> (usu. of a right, as opp. to possession): <cit><quote lang="la">sed regnum ad se et ad matrem suam pertinere arbitrabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem jure regnum pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona ad me pertinent, solus enim sum filius defuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Europa jam, dubio procul, jure ad Romanos pertinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Armenia) quae antea ad majores suos pertinuisse monstrabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35629.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To belong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be the property of</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae ad se pertinebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 25, 21</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pertĭnenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">aptly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appositely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertinently</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pertinenter ad causam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinentissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertingo: <entryFree id="n35630" type="main" key="pertingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n35630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> to a certain point (rare; not in Cic.; often confounded in MSS. with pertineo). </sense><sense id="n35630.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis in immensum pertingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 3</bibl></cit> Dietsch and Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">montis Apennini jugum mediā curvaturā prope tangens oras maris Hadriani pertingit circumitionibus contra fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infortunatam pertingens cespite Trojam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 986</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris, cujus culmen pertingat ad caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 28, 9</bibl> al. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 277</bibl>, the correct read. is perterget, v. Lachm. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n35630.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sapientiam Zenonis pertingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=255" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 255</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertisum: <entryFree id="n35631" type="gloss" key="perti_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertīsum</orth>, v. pertaedet <sense id="n35631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pertolero: <entryFree id="n35632" type="hapax" key="perto^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tŏlĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormenta aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertolerarem vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Rel. v. 91" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 91</bibl></cit> Rib.</sense></entryFree>
pertono: <entryFree id="n35633" type="main" key="perto^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n35633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thunder violently</hi> (late Lat.).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to thunder away at any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53</bibl></cit>, n. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">quando vero vox illa pertonuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Helv. 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thunder forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 61</bibl></cit>, ad Pammach. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. Fer. 2</bibl></cit>, Pentec.</sense></entryFree>
pertorqueo: <entryFree id="n35634" type="main" key="pertorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twist awry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora foedo sapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 401</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35634.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vent</hi>: quam senticosa verba pertorquet, Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=339" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 339</bibl> Müll. and ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> ib. (Com. Rel. v. 1 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
pertractate: <entryFree id="n35635" type="main" key="pertracta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertractātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pertracto <sense id="n35635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pertractatio: <entryFree id="n35636" type="main" key="pertracta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertractātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pertrectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pertracto, a touching; hence trop.</etym>, <sense id="n35636.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A handling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partium aegrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35636.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A handling</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an occupying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">busying one's self with</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">application</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertractator: <entryFree id="n35637" type="main" key="pertracta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertractātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a handler</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. 3, 2.</sense></entryFree>
pertracto: <entryFree id="n35638" type="main" key="pertracto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tracto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pertrecto</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi> any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n35638.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">papillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestias manibus, Auct. B. afr. 72: arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput dormienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus hominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 362</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35638.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to busy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupy one's self with</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem omni cogitatione pertractans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus mentesque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad totam philosophiam pertractandam se dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertractare ea quae rem continent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum quae scripsi mecum ipse pertracto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertractare visu vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to explore</tr>, <tr>scan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:452" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 452</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PERT" /> mente, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Nahum. 1, 11</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tractātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in a well-considered manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">systematically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam pertractate facta est (fabula),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a moral in view</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertractus: <entryFree id="n35639" type="main" key="pertractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pertraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35640" type="main" key="pertractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pertraho</etym>, <sense id="n35640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duration</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Orat. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertraho: <entryFree id="n35641" type="main" key="pertra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct forcibly</hi> to a place (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n35641.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem ad ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertractus ad Vitellium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem Romam ad centumviros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam suam in jus, ad aliam civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit> ext.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem intra moenia vinctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, n. 8.— </sense><sense id="n35641.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi> to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum iniquum pertractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem ad insidiarum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35641.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 173" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 173</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35641.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lead away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead astray</hi>: sui erroris arbitrio pertrahere et alios multos, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
pertralucidus: <entryFree id="n35642" type="main" key="pertra_lu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trālūcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very translucid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertranseo: <entryFree id="n35643" type="main" key="pertranse^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-transĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi, īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n35643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum viridis aspectus (smaragdi), non pertransit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n35643.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35643.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass by</hi> (late Lat.; not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 8, 26, v. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Levita, cum esset secus locum et videret eum, pertransiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35643.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec pertranseat indignatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 26, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertrecto: <entryFree id="n35644" type="main" key="pertrecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertrecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. pertracto.</entryFree>
pertremisco: <entryFree id="n35645" type="main" key="pertre^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trĕmisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n35645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble greatly at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in great fear of</hi> (late Lat.); with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 2</bibl>: similem sententiam, Hier. cont. Pelag. 1, 38.</sense></entryFree>
pertrepidus: <entryFree id="n35646" type="main" key="pertre^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in great alarm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in great haste</hi>: senatus pertrepidus in aedem Concordiae concurrit, Capitol. Maxim. et Balb. 1, 1 dub. (Peter, praetrepidus).</sense></entryFree>
pertribuo: <entryFree id="n35647" type="main" key="pertri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium alicui (al. retribuere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit> (but ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:95" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 95</bibl> the correct read. is perhibere).</sense></entryFree>
pertricosus: <entryFree id="n35648" type="main" key="pertri_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very confused</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very strange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pertricosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:63:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 63, 14</bibl></cit> dub. (al. praetricosa).</sense></entryFree>
pertristis: <entryFree id="n35649" type="main" key="pertristis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tristis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mournful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: carmen, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14.—</sense><sense id="n35649.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very austere</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertritus: <entryFree id="n35650" type="main" key="pertri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n35650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rubbed to pieces;</hi> from pertero.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35651" type="main" key="pertri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite worn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very hackneyed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very trite</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:18:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio pertritum jam hoc esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertrux: <entryFree id="n35652" type="main" key="pertrux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-trux</orth>, <itype>ŭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very savage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertumesco: <entryFree id="n35653" type="gloss" key="pertu^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tŭmesco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell up greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertumidus: <entryFree id="n35654" type="main" key="pertu^mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tŭmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly swelled out</hi>: luna (Elm. protumida), App. de Deo Socr. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pertumultuose: <entryFree id="n35655" type="main" key="pertu^multu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tŭmultŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a very agitated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumultuous manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid nunciare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pertunda: <entryFree id="n35656" type="main" key="Pertunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pertunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pertundo</etym>, <sense id="n35656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over the loss of virginity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 11</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
pertundo: <entryFree id="n35657" type="main" key="pertundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-tundo</orth>, <itype>tŭdi, tūsum</itype> (tussum; <sense id="n35657.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">pertunsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 9:10" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 9, 10</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thrust through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a hole through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bore through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforate</hi> (mostly ante-class.; not in Cic. or Cæs.): latus pertudit hasta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 891</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 395 Vahl.); cf.: me pertudit in latus, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 81</bibl> (Ann. v. 540 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">terebrā vitem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calicem per fundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crumenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae saxa pertundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna terebrare et pertundere perque forare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 32, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positos tineā pertunde libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam venam,</quote> <trans><tr>to lance</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapide ungulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pertūsus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>P. a.</pos>, <cb n="PERT" /> <hi rend="ital">perforated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has a hole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertusa sella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compita,</quote> <trans><tr>passable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 131</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingerere aliquid in pertusum dolium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to spend one's time to no purpose</tr>, <tr>to labor in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 135</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia pertusum congesta quasi in vas Commoda perfluxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 937</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere in sacculum pertusum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ag. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perturbate: <entryFree id="n35658" type="main" key="perturba_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perturbo, <sense id="n35658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perturbatio: <entryFree id="n35659" type="main" key="perturba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perturbo</etym>, <sense id="n35659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35659.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli (opp. serenitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 13, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35659.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35659.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">political disturbance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim aliud tumultus nisi perturbatio tanta, ut major timor oriatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas perturbationes et quantos aestus habet ratio comitiorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim omnes post interitum Caesaris novarum perturbationum causae quaeri viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis, quo in motu temporum, quantā in conversione rerum ac perturbatione versemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 37, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna totius exercitūs perturbatio facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35659.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mental</hi> or <hi rend="ital">personal disturbance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perturbation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus atque perturbatio animorum atque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae et magna confusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35659.5" n="C" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an emotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>: quae Graeci <foreign lang="greek">pa/qh</foreign> vocant, nobis perturbationes appellari magis placet, quam morbos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur Zenonis haec definitio, ut perturbatio sit aversa a rectā ratione, contra naturam animi commotio: quidam brevius perturbationem esse appetitum vehementiorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā (vitiositate) concitantur perturbationes, quae sunt turbidi animorum concitatique motus, aversi a ratione et inimicissimi mentis vitaeque tranquillae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbationes sunt genere quatuor, partibus plures, aegritudo, formido, libido, laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetu quodam animi et perturbatione magis, quam judicio aut consilio regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbationem afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in perturbationes atque exanimationes incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to tranquillitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perturbativus: <entryFree id="n35660" type="main" key="perturba_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing disturbance</hi>, Cassiod.</sense></entryFree>
perturbator: <entryFree id="n35661" type="main" key="perturba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disquieter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturber</hi> (eccl. Lat. for turbator, cf. turbo): <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spirit. Sanc. 3, 17, 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perturbatrix: <entryFree id="n35662" type="main" key="perturba_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perturbator</etym>, <sense id="n35662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that disquiets</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disturbs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perturbatus: <entryFree id="n35663" type="main" key="perturba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perturbo.</entryFree>
perturbidus: <entryFree id="n35664" type="main" key="perturbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-turbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very unquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of disturbance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Saturn. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perturbo: <entryFree id="n35665" type="main" key="perturbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw into confusion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (cf.: confundo, misceo). </sense><sense id="n35665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatum ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones pactionesque bellicas perjurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies intermissus aut nox interposita saepe perturbat omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos (milites) incertis ordinibus perturbaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35665.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingle together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia subtiliter cretā permisceas cum salibus torrefactis ac tritis et diu oleo injecto perturbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35665.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discompose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes animosque perturbat timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore perturbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum, joined with concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 37, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rei publicae salute perturbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec te vox non perculit? non perturbavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno animi motu perturbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n35665.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi civitatem perturbatam vestris legibus et contionibus et deductionibus tradidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbatissimum tempestatis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma quassatae rei publicae perturbatorumque temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1360" /> <cb n="PERU" /> 73.—</sense><sense id="n35665.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discomposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo perturbatior metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane sum perturbatus cum ipsius familiaritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-turbāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">confused visions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverted truths</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc onusti cibo et vino perturbata et confusa cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perturbātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid perturbate, ne quid contorte dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta animalia perturbate moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 124:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 124, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perturpis: <entryFree id="n35666" type="main" key="perturpis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-turpis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scandalous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 50</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pertusio: <entryFree id="n35667" type="main" key="pertu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pertundo</etym>, <sense id="n35667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perforation</hi> (late Lat.), Ps. Soran. Quu. Medic. 230.</sense></entryFree>
pertusura: <entryFree id="n35668" type="main" key="pertu_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertūsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thrusting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boring through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pertusus: <entryFree id="n35669" type="main" key="pertu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pertūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pertundo.</entryFree>
perubique: <entryFree id="n35670" type="main" key="pe^ru^bi_que_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ŭbīquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
perula: <entryFree id="n35671" type="main" key="pe_ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pērŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pera</etym>, <sense id="n35671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wallet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pocket.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35671.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes fregit exemptum e perulā calicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35671.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, comic., = uterus intumescens, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perunctio: <entryFree id="n35672" type="main" key="pe^runcti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perungo</etym>, <sense id="n35672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besmearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anointing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:131 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 131 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
perunctus: <entryFree id="n35673" type="main" key="pe^runctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perungo.</entryFree>
perungo: <entryFree id="n35674" type="main" key="pe^rungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ungo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-unguo</orth>, <itype>unxi, unctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anoint</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 756</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nardo perunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faecibus ora peruncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 277</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perunitus: <entryFree id="n35675" type="main" key="pe^ru_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ūnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">united</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Primas in Ep. ad Cor. 15.</sense></entryFree>
perurbane: <entryFree id="n35676" type="main" key="pe^rurba_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrurbānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perurbanus <sense id="n35676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perurbanus: <entryFree id="n35677" type="main" key="pe^rurba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-urbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very polite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">witty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35677.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Torquatus elegans in dicendo, toto genere perurbanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Lucilius et doctus et perurbanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35677.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with a bad accessory signif., <hi rend="ital">over-fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-polite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rusticis potius quam cum his perurbanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrurbānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very elegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perurgeo: <entryFree id="n35678" type="main" key="pe^rurge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-urgĕo</orth>, <itype>ursi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35678.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>: cum Aureolus perurgeret Illyrium, Treb. Gall. 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35678.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urge greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad capessendam rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinationem, Treb. Trig. Tyr. 33, 8: sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>to take great pains with</tr>, <tr>to apply one's self earnestly to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peruro: <entryFree id="n35679" type="main" key="pe^ru_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ūro</orth>, <itype>ussi, ustum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn through and through;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n35679.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35679.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To burn up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perussit ignis multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perusti late agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 49, § 165</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to be burned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scorched</hi> by the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyco sole perusta coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 46: <cit><quote lang="la">mixti Garamante perusto,</quote> <trans><tr>sunburned</tr>, <tr>swarthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perusti Indiae populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 484" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zona perusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35679.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febri peruri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis praecipue fatigatas perurebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35679.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rub sore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ibericis peruste funibus latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneri colla perusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35679.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of cold, <hi rend="ital">to nip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pinch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substramentis per hiemem operito, ne peruratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra perusta gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perurere congelationibus vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35679.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem perustum gloriā volunt incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valido perurimur aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uniones), qui male cor meum perurunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:49:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 49, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 78, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 547" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 547</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:76" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatis maledictum quosdam perurit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perusia: <entryFree id="n35680" type="main" key="Pe^ru^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrŭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the twelve confederate towns of Etruria</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Perugia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35680.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrŭsī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Perusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perusina cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the siege of Perusia by Octavianus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:45:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46</bibl></cit>. § 148; the famine produced in the town by this <cb n="PERV" /> siege (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl>) is referred to in Perusina fames, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕ-rŭsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Perusians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 30 sq.</bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrŭsīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a countryseat in the Perusian territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perustus: <entryFree id="n35681" type="main" key="pe^rustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from peruro.</entryFree>
perutilis: <entryFree id="n35682" type="main" key="pe^ru_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very useful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
