pervado: <entryFree id="n35683" type="main" key="perva_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vādo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread through</hi> (class.; syn. penetro). </sense><sense id="n35683.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone, or with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: pervade polum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 13</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 190 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">incendium per agros pervasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnis partis provinciae te tamquam aliquam calamitosam pestem tempestatemque pervasisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">96: ne cum in Siciliā quidem fuit ... pars ejus belli in Italiam ulla pervasit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: per aequa et iniqua loca pervadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervadere usque ad vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars magna equitum ad terga pugnantium pervasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessaliam cum exercitu pervadit, id, 42, 13, 8: venenum ita cunctos ejus artus pervasit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetu equi pervasit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervasā urbe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervasis regionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 3, 309</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35683.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaedam calamitas pervadere videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35683.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35683.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spread through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio, quae per animos gentium barbararum pervaserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non illius diei fama pervaserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas oras quasi morbus quidam illius furoris pervaserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 53</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fama ea urbem atque forum pervasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur totam contionem pervasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervasit jam multos ista persuasio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capesse, per deos, rem publicam, et omnia aspera pervade,</quote> <trans><tr>to break through</tr>, <tr>overcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. Rep. Ord. 1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. Rep. Ord. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:427" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam Asiae partem cis Euphraten tanti mali fama pervaserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque proximus ab oppresso sit, per omnis velut continens incendium pervasurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae Romanae fama cum pervasisset in Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror in totam penitus aciem pervasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex contagione, velut tabes, in Perrhaebiam quoque id pervaserat malum (i. e. seditiones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 5, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35683.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To arrive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, quo non nostrorum hominum libido pervaserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 307</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervagabilis: <entryFree id="n35684" type="main" key="perva^ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervăgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pervagor</etym>, <sense id="n35684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ranging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sweeping through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cymbulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervagatus: <entryFree id="n35685" type="main" key="perva^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervăgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pervagor.</entryFree>
pervagor: <entryFree id="n35686" type="main" key="perva^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-văgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n35686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">range through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rove about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overrun</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35686.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic praedonum naviculae pervagatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis imperat, ut omnibus in locis pervagentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio pervagata bello prope orbem terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35686.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35686.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in exteris nationibus usque ad ultimas terras pervagatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardores in agris pervagantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35686.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spread through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timores omnium mentes pervagantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor omnia membra pervagabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35686.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be widely spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne is honos nimium pervagetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 113</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervăgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n35686.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide-spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe et late pervagata anteponantur angustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervagatissimus versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 8, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35686.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervagatior pars,</quote> <trans><tr>of a more general nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervagus: <entryFree id="n35687" type="main" key="perva^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roaming all about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; Sabin. Ep. 1, 91.</sense></entryFree>
pervaleo: <entryFree id="n35688" type="spur" key="perva^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vălĕo</orth>, a false read. for pervolat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 916</bibl> Lachm. ad h. l.) <cb n="PERV" /></entryFree>
pervalidus: <entryFree id="n35689" type="main" key="perva^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vălĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very strong.</hi> agmina, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contritio,</quote> <trans><tr>profound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 30, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervaporo: <entryFree id="n35690" type="main" key="perva^po_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-văpōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill with vapor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73, 5</bibl></cit> Keller (Bücheler, parabatur).</sense></entryFree>
pervarie: <entryFree id="n35691" type="main" key="perva^ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervărĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pervarius <sense id="n35691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pervarius: <entryFree id="n35692" type="main" key="perva^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very various</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socrat. p. 42</bibl></cit> dub.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervărĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very variously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervarie narrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervasio: <entryFree id="n35693" type="main" key="perva_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pervado</etym>, <sense id="n35693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invad ing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invasion</hi> (late Lat.): rerum alienarum pervasio, Salv. Gub. Dei, 5, 10.</sense></entryFree>
pervasor: <entryFree id="n35694" type="main" key="perva_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invader</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 20</bibl>; Cod. Th. 2, 4, 5.</sense></entryFree>
pervasto: <entryFree id="n35695" type="main" key="pervasto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vasto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervastatis passim agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervastata Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boii Laevos cum pervastassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervasus: <entryFree id="n35696" type="main" key="perva_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pervado.</entryFree>
pervectio: <entryFree id="n35697" type="main" key="pervecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perveho</etym>, <sense id="n35697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying through</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 13.</sense></entryFree>
pervector: <entryFree id="n35698" type="main" key="pervector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">apicum,</quote> <trans><tr>a letter-carrier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:65" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervectus: <entryFree id="n35699" type="main" key="pervectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perveho.</entryFree>
perveho: <entryFree id="n35700" type="main" key="perve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">convey through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: commeatus, Liv 44, 6, 6.—Mid.: pervehi, <hi rend="ital">to pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanum pervehitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucri litora classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35700.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi> to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines Caere pervexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus...Romam usque pervexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sandaracha et ochra inde pervehuntur ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 22, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo molliter me pervehat (sc. equus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 9</bibl>.—Mid.: pervehi, <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go</hi> to a place: dictator ubi currum insidit, pervehitur usque ad oppidum, Poët. (not Enn.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervectus Chalcidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervectus in Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gades usque pervectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 169</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exitus optatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of pedestrians, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cito passu pervecta ad litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervello: <entryFree id="n35701" type="main" key="pervello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vello</orth>, <itype>velli, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pluck hard; to pull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iwitch</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n35701.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 32</bibl></cit>; also, prov., aurem, <hi rend="ital">to pull one's ear</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to remind one of</hi> a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:7:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:55" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:36:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:7:6" default="NO">5, 7, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35701.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35701.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35701.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To twitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pinch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna pervellere te forsitan potuerit et pungere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te forte dolor aliquis pervellerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35701.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35701.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enliven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad referendam gratiam fides languet: hanc pervellamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervenio: <entryFree id="n35702" type="main" key="perve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (old <sense id="n35702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> pervenibunt, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> pervenat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> pervenirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 35</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n35702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotumo die Sicuone huc pervenisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani in fines Eburonum pervenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summum montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:909" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 909</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35702.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become known to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad erum haec res pervenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lupinum ad siliquas non pervenit,</quote> <trans><tr>does not come to pods</tr>, <tr>does not form pods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecim secures in praedonum potestatem pervenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnis hereditas ad filiam perveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrula ad Stratonem pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona ad denarios L in singulos modios pervenerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had risen to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenit res ad istius aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>; for which <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba aures non pervenientia nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 462</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam est in thalami tecta Perventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 375</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 634</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35702.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive at; to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain to</hi> any thing: sine me pervenire, quo <pb n="1361" /> <cb n="PERV" /> volo (in my story), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitas colonum ad fructus pervenire non patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximam invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: in senatum, <hi rend="ital">to get into the Senate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to become a senator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad primos comoedos,</quote> <trans><tr>to become a first-rate comedian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in tua scripta pervenero,</quote> <trans><tr>to be mentioned in your writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id, quod cupiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. venire): ad magnam partem laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditio, ex quā ad Jugurtham scelerum impunitas, in rem publicam damna atque dedecora pervenerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in odium alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alc. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tot procellis civilibus ad incolumitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad desperationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magnum timorem. ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad septuagesimum regni annum pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenirier Eo quo nos volumus,</quote> <trans><tr>attain our object</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin erat dicturus, ad quem propter diei brevitatem perventum non est,</quote> <trans><tr>his turn was not reached</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad manus pervenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 36, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervenor: <entryFree id="n35703" type="hapax" key="perve_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vēnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n35703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hunt through;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem totam pervenarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit> (v. 818 Ritschl).</sense></entryFree>
perventio: <entryFree id="n35704" type="main" key="perventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pervenio</etym>, <sense id="n35704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arrival</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 406</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perventor: <entryFree id="n35705" type="main" key="perventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arriver</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cons. Evang. 2:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cons. Evang. 2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pervenustus: <entryFree id="n35706" type="main" key="perve^nustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĕnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very comely</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perverse: <entryFree id="n35707" type="main" key="perverse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perversē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pervorsē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perverto, <sense id="n35707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perversio: <entryFree id="n35708" type="main" key="perversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perverto</etym>, <sense id="n35708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inversion; a wresting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perversion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perversitas: <entryFree id="n35709" type="main" key="perversi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perversĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perversus</etym>, <sense id="n35709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frowardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untowardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perversity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est autem in hominibus tanta perversitas, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna perversitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestissima diligentiae perversitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilis hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perversus: <entryFree id="n35710" type="main" key="perversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perversus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pervorsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perverto.</entryFree>
perverto: <entryFree id="n35711" type="main" key="perverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pervorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn around</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n35711.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pinus proceras pervortunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 196 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">(coqui) aulas pervortunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim ballistā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum visam beluam immanem, quàcunque incederet, arbusta, virgulta, tecta pervertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversae rupes,</quote> <trans><tr>broken</tr>, <tr>craggy rocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35711.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in wrestling or boxing, <hi rend="ital">to throw down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock down;</hi> hence: <cit><quote lang="la">si rex opstabit ob viam, regem ipsum prius pervortito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35711.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35711.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert; to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito homo pervorti potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefactare atque pervertere amicitiam aut justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam, propositis malorum et bonorum finibus, omne officium perverterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia jura divina atque humana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (Quinctius) postquam Junium pervertit, totam causam reliquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 39, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium vim se perversurum putavit, pervertit autem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amicitiā alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos et ambitio pervertet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35711.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi> one (in allusion to the meaning I. B. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo umquam me tenuissimā suspicione perstrinxit, quem non perverterim ac perfregerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ille me opprimet consilio, numquam ullo artificio pervertet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perver-sus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pervorsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turned the wrong way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">askew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awry</hi> (cf. praeposterus). </sense><sense id="n35711.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: rectus perversusque partus, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversas induit comas,</quote> <trans><tr>gets her false hair on awry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondere capitum perversa ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 16, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>: perversa vestis, i. e. pulla, Sen. <cb n="PERV" /> Ira, 1, 16, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">Roscius erat perversissimis oculis, quales sunt strabonum,</quote> <trans><tr>dreadfully squint-eyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35711.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">perverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies pervorsus atque advorsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil pravum et perversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid magis inquinatum, deformatum, perversum, conturbatum dici potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo praeposterus atque perversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Contra fata deūm perverso numine poscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversa grammaticorum subtilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generatio perversa,</quote> <trans><tr>wicked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 20</bibl></cit> et saep. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perversum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in perversum sollers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perversē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pervor-sē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">awry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wrong way.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35711.8" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella curulis in senatu perverse collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35711.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">perversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>: dicere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 4, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 229 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erras pervorse, pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid fleri pervorse videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: si quid perverse tetreque factum est, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:23:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti deorum beneficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 32, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiescite agere perverse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversissime suspicari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervesperi: <entryFree id="n35712" type="hapax" key="pervespe^ri_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vespĕrī</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very late in the evening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervestigatio: <entryFree id="n35713" type="main" key="pervesti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervestīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pervestigo</etym>, <sense id="n35713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervestigator: <entryFree id="n35714" type="main" key="pervesti_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervestīgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinae bibliothecae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vir. Illustr. 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervestigo: <entryFree id="n35715" type="main" key="pervesti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vestīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trace out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35715.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of hounds; <cit><quote lang="la">hence of spies: canes venaticos diceres, ita omnia odorabantur et pervestigabant, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35715.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to seek out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam ut sumam ad pervestigandum, ubi sit illaec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae a me pervestigata et cognita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Locris sacrilegium pervestigatum a Q. Minucio erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervetus: <entryFree id="n35716" type="main" key="perve^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĕtus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum ligneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">72: amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula sed sero allata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum non pervetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervetustus: <entryFree id="n35717" type="main" key="perve^tustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĕtustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perviam: <entryFree id="n35718" type="main" key="pervi^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>per-via</etym>, <sense id="n35718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accessible</hi> (cf. pervius; <cit><quote lang="la">ante-class. and post-Aug.): angulos aedium perviam facitis, i. q. pervios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Orat. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Orat. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Mai: divus Augustus reprehendens Ti. Claudium ita loquitur: Scribis enim perviam <foreign lang="greek">a)nti\ tou=</foreign> obviam, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 187</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
perviaticum: <entryFree id="n35719" type="hapax" key="pervi^a_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĭātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">money for a journey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perviaticum publice decretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Amic. 2, 6</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
pervicacia: <entryFree id="n35720" type="main" key="pervi^ca_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭcācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pervicax</etym>, <sense id="n35720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexibility;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">stubbornness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacia, perseverantia): avaritia, ambitio, mulierositas, pervicacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pervicacia tua et superbia coëgit me loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 24</bibl></cit>: Aegyptia, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35720.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a milder signif., <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfastness</hi>: tu pertinaciam esse, hanc praedicas, ego pervicaciam aio, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 432, 32 sq.</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 4 Rib.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the entire passage under pervicax): quantā pervicaciā in hostem, tantā beneficentiā adversus supplices utendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: castanea pedamentis omnibus praefertur perdurandi pervicaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervicaciter: <entryFree id="n35721" type="main" key="pervi^ca_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭcācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pervicax <sense id="n35721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pervicax: <entryFree id="n35722" type="main" key="pervi^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per and root vicof vinco</etym>, <sense id="n35722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined;</hi> esp. in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">stubborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headstrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wilful</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): tu pertinaciam esse, Antiloche, hanc praedicas: Ego pervicaciam aio et eā me uti volo ... Nam pervicacem dici me esse et vincere Perfacile <cb n="PERV" /> patior: pertinacem nil moror? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 432, 32 sq.</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 8 Rib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus peritos pervicax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">musa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicacissimi Latinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicacioris irae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines pervicaci audaciā, pertinaci spe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n35722.1" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">steady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmoved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra flatus pervicax libra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 161</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35722.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti pervicax, constans adversus metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭ-cācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stoutly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stubbornly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicaciter perstare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicacius causam belli quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 54</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pervictus: <entryFree id="n35723" type="main" key="pervictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pervinco.</entryFree>
pervicus: <entryFree id="n35724" type="main" key="pervi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pervico for pervinco</etym>, <sense id="n35724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stubborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi> (ante-class. collat. form of pervicax): pervico Ajax animo atque evocabili, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 15</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 131 Rib.); Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pervidens: <entryFree id="n35725" type="main" key="pervi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pervideo.</entryFree>
pervideo: <entryFree id="n35726" type="main" key="pervi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>vīdi, vīsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35726.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol pervidet omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 375</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35726.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctaque mens oculis pervidet illa suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tua pervideas oculis mala lippus inunctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35726.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35726.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervideamus, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:956" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 956</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbo te et pervidebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (B. and K. promonebo).—</sense><sense id="n35726.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 90</bibl> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 2. pervolo): meritorum meorum fieri accessionem pervidere te spero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitatem animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervidentissimus princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 11</bibl></cit> dub. (al. providentissimus).</sense></entryFree>
pervigeo: <entryFree id="n35727" type="hapax" key="pervi^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to continue blooming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bloom to the last</hi>: opibus atque honoribus perviguere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">remained in constant possession of</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pervigil: <entryFree id="n35728" type="main" key="pervi^gi^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭgĭl</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭgĭlis</orth>: <sense id="n35728.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 270, 31</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ever watchful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pernox): pervigil in mediae sidera noctis eras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigilem draconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigiles et insomnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 809" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popinae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>open all night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35728.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans><tr>passed without sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervigilatio: <entryFree id="n35729" type="main" key="pervi^gi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭgĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pervigil</etym>, <sense id="n35729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a devotional watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vigil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae pervigilationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervigilia: <entryFree id="n35730" type="main" key="pervi^gi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭgĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching all night long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigiliae malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:8:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 43</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
pervigilium: <entryFree id="n35731" type="main" key="pervi^gi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭgĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching all night</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a remaining awake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sitting up all night long.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35731.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 118, § 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigilio fatigati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter cotidiana pervigilia fessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:29:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35731.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a devotional watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vigil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra pervigilio neglecta, Liv 23, 35: celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigilio anniversario colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>: Pervigilium Veneris, <hi rend="ital">the name of a little Latin poem by an unknown author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of perhaps the second century</hi> A. D.</sense></entryFree>
pervigilo: <entryFree id="n35732" type="main" key="pervi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭgĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain awake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">watch all night; to remain awake during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch through</hi> any period: <cit><quote lang="la">continuas has tris noctis pervigilavi pessume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilare leve est, pervigilare grave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:69:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 69, 9</bibl></cit> and 10: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad luminis ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 291</bibl></cit>: nox pervigilata in mero, <hi rend="ital">watched through</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spent without sleep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:326" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 326</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitas trivio pervigilare moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep a vigil all night in honor of Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35732.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to keep watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tecum longos pervigilare dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi pervigilant, quasi rationem pro animabus vestris reddituri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 13, 17</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1362" /> <cb n="PERV" /></sense></entryFree>
pervilis: <entryFree id="n35733" type="main" key="pervi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cheap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 219</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pervinca: <entryFree id="n35734" type="main" key="pervinca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervinca</orth>, v. vinca pervinca.</entryFree>
pervinco: <entryFree id="n35735" type="main" key="pervinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n35735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35735.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35735.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conquer completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain a complete victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicit Bardanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35735.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defeat completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain a complete victory over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nos subdolā perfidiā pervincamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervince, Theseu, quidquid alto in pectore Remanet pavoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 654" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominae pervincere mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35735.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35735.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain one's opinion</hi>: restitit ac pervicit <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Cic. Att. 2, 1, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35735.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outdo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35735.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To induce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prevail upon with great effort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to effect with much labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">achieve</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">multis rationibus pervicerat Rhodios, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illam non verbera, non ignes pervicere, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicerunt quidem remis, ut tenerent terram,</quote> <trans><tr>they brought it about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pervincere potuit, ut referrent consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est tibi pervincendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35735.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To outbid</hi> in buying: <cit><quote lang="la">si amas, eme: facito ut pretio pervincas tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35735.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervincus: <entryFree id="n35736" type="gloss" key="Pervincus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pervincus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. e. <sense id="n35736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Achiever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 16, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pervio: <entryFree id="n35737" type="main" key="pervi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 104 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
pervirens: <entryFree id="n35738" type="main" key="pervi^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĭrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vireo], <sense id="n35738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ever flourishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever green</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perviridis: <entryFree id="n35739" type="main" key="pervi^ri^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vĭrĭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 53, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl> (al. praeviridis).</sense></entryFree>
perviso: <entryFree id="n35740" type="main" key="pervi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vīso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 925</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervivo: <entryFree id="n35741" type="main" key="pervi_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vīvo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to live on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survive</hi> to a certain time (ante-class.): pervixi usque adhuc, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 238, 2</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 417 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">pervivo usque ad summam aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervius: <entryFree id="n35742" type="main" key="pervi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-via</etym>, <sense id="n35742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a passage through;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n35742.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that may be passed through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crossed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affording a passage through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitiones,</quote> <trans><tr>thoroughfares</tr>, <tr>passages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes saltus pervios ceperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus Tectorum inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebo non pervia taxus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>impervious to the sun's rays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervius hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rima pervia flatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ulli pervia vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:762" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo loca pervia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:377" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baianae pervia cymbae stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde maxime pervius amnis,</quote> <trans><tr>is most fordable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phasis pontibus CXX. pervius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacraria Fauni pervia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>accessible to all</tr>, <tr>not set apart by consecration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a thoroughfare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pervium illa Germanis exercitibus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35742.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35742.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that makes a passage through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:249" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 249</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35742.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierced</hi>: anulus, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35742.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cor meum mihi nunc pervium est, <hi rend="ital">my heart is now open</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">light</hi> or <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 70</bibl> (760 Ritschl): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ambitioni pervium,</quote> <trans><tr>accessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervolaticus: <entryFree id="n35743" type="main" key="pervo^la_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-vŏlātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volatile</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vis vaga et pervolatica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pervolgo: <entryFree id="n35744" type="main" key="pervolgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pervolgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. pervulgo.</entryFree>
