petaurum: <entryFree id="n35794" type="greek" key="pe^taurum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtaurum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/tauron</foreign>, <sense id="n35794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring-board</hi> used by tumblers and rope-dancers, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. petauristae, p. 206 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:21:3" default="NO">11, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:265" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 265</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 434</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petax: <entryFree id="n35795" type="main" key="pe^tax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peto</etym>, <sense id="n35795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">catching at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striving after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy for</hi> any thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ornatūs petax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiae petax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">adv. comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtācĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">more greedily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Progn. 432</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petelia: <entryFree id="n35796" type="main" key="Pe^te_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtēlĭa</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtīlĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtellĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pethli/a</foreign> <sense id="n35796.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient town in the Bruttian territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of Croton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colonized by Lucanians</hi>, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Strongoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 96</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35796.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtēlī-nus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtellīn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Petelian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petelinus lucus, near Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petelina fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtēlīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Petelia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Petelians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3678</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35796.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city on the western coast of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between</hi> Paestum <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Velia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 8</bibl>, ext. 1.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35796.3" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtēlīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Petelians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3939</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petelinus: <entryFree id="n35797" type="main" key="Pe^te_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtēlīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Petelia, I. B. and II. B.</entryFree>
peteon: <entryFree id="n35798" type="main" key="Pe^te^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtĕōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*petew/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:333" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petesso: <entryFree id="n35799" type="main" key="pe^tesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtesso</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtisso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n35799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [peto], <hi rend="ital">to strive after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seek for repeatedly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">petissere antiqui pro petere dicebant. Sed, ut mihi videtur, cum significabant saepius petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: petissere petere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam caedesque petessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras petessens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petibilis: <entryFree id="n35800" type="main" key="pe^ti_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peto</etym>, <sense id="n35800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capable of being demanded</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Possid. Vita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petiginosus: <entryFree id="n35801" type="main" key="pe^ti_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>petigo</etym>, <sense id="n35801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of scabs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eruptions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petigo: <entryFree id="n35802" type="main" key="pe^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an eruption</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">petigo genus morbi. Lucilius, lib. XXX.: illuvies, scabies . . . petigo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 17 sq.</bibl></cit> (others read, deque petigo; so in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, Schneid. reads depetigini).</sense></entryFree>
petilia: <entryFree id="n35803" type="main" key="Pe^ti_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Petelia.</entryFree>
petilianus: <entryFree id="n35804" type="main" key="Pe^ti_li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Petilius, B.</entryFree>
petilium: <entryFree id="n35805" type="main" key="pe^ti_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtīlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an autumnal flower</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 25, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petilius: <entryFree id="n35806" type="main" key="Pe^ti_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n35806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n35806.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Petilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Petilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35806.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Petilian</hi>: regna, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the villa of a certain Petilius</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petilus: <entryFree id="n35807" type="main" key="pe^ti_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtīlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">petilum tenue et exile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 7 sq.</bibl></cit>; Lucil. and Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">petilam suram, siccam et substrictam vulgo interpretantur: Scaevola ait, ungulam albam equi ita dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
petimen: <entryFree id="n35808" type="main" key="pe^ti^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtĭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, perh. <sense id="n35808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sore on the shoulder</hi> of beasts of burden or draught (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">petimina in umeris jumentorum ulcera: eo nomine autem et inter duos armos suis quod est aut pectus solitum appellari, testatur Naevius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=209" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 209</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: petimina in umeris jumentorum ulcera, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=208" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 208</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
petina: <entryFree id="n35809" type="main" key="Peti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ælia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wife of the emperor Claudius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he divorced before marrying Messalina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petiolus: <entryFree id="n35810" type="main" key="pe^ti^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n35810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little leg</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n35810.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nudus, Afr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in petiolis capitulisque haedorum et vitulorum et agnorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35810.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stalk</hi> of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">petioli, quibus mala pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 23:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the olive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 49, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petisius: <entryFree id="n35811" type="main" key="Petisi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petisĭus</orth>, <itype>a, am</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Petisian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <trans><tr>a small sort of apple</tr>, <tr>paradise-apples</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petisso: <entryFree id="n35812" type="main" key="pe^tisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtisso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. petesso.</entryFree>
petitio: <entryFree id="n35813" type="main" key="pe^ti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peto</etym>. <sense id="n35813.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an</hi> <cb n="PETO" /> <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas petiti ones effugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">petitiones proprie dicimus impetus gladiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 439</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35813.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi> made in words before a court of justice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or in debate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novi omnis hominis petitiones rationesque dicendi,</quote> <trans><tr>methods of attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35813.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a requesting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseeching; a request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petition</hi> for any thing (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 19, § 66</bibl>: huic quoque petitioni tuae negare non sustineo, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 7</bibl> (23); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:8 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35813.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a request</hi> offered to God, <hi rend="ital">a prayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impleat Dominus omnes petitiones tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Johan. 5, 15: petitionem offerre Domino Deo, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 16, 1, 4.—</sense><sense id="n35813.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35813.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An applying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soliciting for office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an application</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candidacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitioni se dari,</quote> <trans><tr>to become a candidate for office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatūs et aedilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui petitionem consulatūs,</quote> <trans><tr>to admit one as a candidate for the consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinere petitione honorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitioni se dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to solicit an office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35813.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A laying claim to</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petition</hi>, in private or civil cases (opp. the accusatio, in criminal cases): <cit><quote lang="la">petitio pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integram petitionem relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35813.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A right of claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a right to bring an action of recovery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere, neminem, cujus petitio sit, petiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:56" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petitiuncula: <entryFree id="n35814" type="gloss" key="pe^ti_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>petitio</etym>, <sense id="n35814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little petition</hi>: petitiuncula, <foreign lang="greek">dehsi/dion</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
petitor: <entryFree id="n35815" type="main" key="pe^ti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>peto</etym>. <sense id="n35815.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a seeker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striver</hi> after any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35815.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35815.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Polit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an applicant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">candidate</hi> for an office (very rare for candidatus; not in Cic.), Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e petitoribus non alios adjuvare aut ad honorem pati pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic generosior Descendat in campum petitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35815.3" n="B" level="2"> Judicial t. t., <hi rend="ital">a claimant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaintiff</hi>, in private or civil suits (whereas he who prefers the complaint in a criminal case is termed accusator; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): quis erat petitor? Fannius: quis reus? Flavius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitoris personam capere, accusatoris deponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:94" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 94</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n35815.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A suitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wooer</hi> (post-class.), App M. 4, p. 309 Oud.; Sen. Fragm. § 39 Haas; Cod. Th. 3, 7, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35815.5" n="D" level="2"> In late Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">MILITIAE,</quote> <trans><tr>a recruiting officer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 531, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Murat. 788, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">794, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petitorius: <entryFree id="n35816" type="main" key="pe^ti_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>petitor</etym>. <sense id="n35816.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to solicitation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">artes petitorias exercere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35816.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the prosecution of a judicial claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petitory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:91 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 91 sq.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the complaint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declaration</hi> in a private action, Cod. Th. 10, 10, 29, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
petitrix: <entryFree id="n35817" type="main" key="pe^ti_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n35817.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female applicant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">candidate</hi> for office (post-Aug.), Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 252" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 252</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35817.1" n="II" level="1"> Judicial t. t., <hi rend="ital">a female claimant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plaintiff</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">contra petitricem pronuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:74" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
petitum: <entryFree id="n35818" type="main" key="pe^ti_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. peto, II. B. 2. b.</entryFree>
petiturio: <entryFree id="n35819" type="main" key="pe^ti_tu^rio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītŭrio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n35819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. a.</hi> [peto], <hi rend="ital">to desire to sue for office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long to become a candidate</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">video hominem valde petiturire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petitus: <entryFree id="n35820" type="main" key="pe^ti_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from peto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35821" type="main" key="pe^ti_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>peto</etym>. <sense id="n35821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inclining towards</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae petitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35821.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi> (post-class.) jussit eum consensu petituque omnium sententiam dicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitu tuo adesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 45 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
peto: <entryFree id="n35822" type="main" key="pe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕto</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n35822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> petīt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ov F. 1, 109: petisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 359</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:55:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 55, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:63:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 63, § 140</bibl>; Ov. <pb n="1365" /> <cb n="PETO" /> M. 9, 623; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 516 sq.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root pat-, to fall upon, fly, find; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pet-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">pi/ptw</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">pi-pe/tw</foreign>), to fall; cf. Lat. impetus and in <foreign lang="greek">pe/tomai</foreign>, to fly; cf. Lat. penna, acci-pit-er, etc.; the root of <foreign lang="greek">pi/ptw</foreign>, and therefore orig. to fall, fall upon; hence, to endeavor to reach or attain any thing</etym>. </sense><sense id="n35822.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n35822.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35822.3" n="1" level="3"> In a hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to rush at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail; to let fly at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim a blow at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust at</hi>, etc. (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invado, aggredior): gladiatores et vitando caute, et petendo vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus latus mucro ille petebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non latus aut ventrem, sed caput et collum petere,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 26, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem spiculo infeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mālo,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw an apple at any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui ungue genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem saxis, id. de Nuce, 2: aprum jaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra disco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello Penatìs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.4" n="2" level="3"> Without the notion of hostility: petere collum alicujus amplexu, <hi rend="ital">to fall upon one's neck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to embrace one</hi>, M. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>.—Esp. freq., <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to direct one's course to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repair to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel to</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">grues loca calidiora petentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyzicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dyrrhachium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek</tr>, <tr>take refuge in their ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum pennis,</quote> <trans><tr>to fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:457" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graiis Phasi petite viris,</quote> <trans><tr>visited by the Greeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus Postumium ad bellum gerendum Africam petentem, ... urbem egredi passus non est,</quote> <trans><tr>attempting to go</tr>, <tr>starting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum petit amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons petit astra,</quote> <trans><tr>towers toward the stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 316</bibl></cit>: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to a person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reginam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te supplex peterem, et tua limina adirem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 115</bibl></cit>: aliquid in locum or ad aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to go to a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">person for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go in quest of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to fetch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visum est tanti in extremam Italiam petere Brundisium ostreas,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to Brundisium for oysters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrham ad Troglodytas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 15, 33, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena ad Aethiopas usque petitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis, in quem vimina petebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque trans maria petimus,</quote> <trans><tr>fetch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 4, 19</bibl></cit>, §§ 58, 52.—</sense><sense id="n35822.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35822.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi> one with any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aiiquem epistulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fraude et insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem falsis criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi> (cf. posco). </sense><sense id="n35822.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita petit asparagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iis tantum, quantum res petet, hauriemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: poenas ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to seek satisfaction from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revenge one's self on any one.</hi> ut poenas ab optimo quoque peteret sui doloris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut merito ab eā poenas liberi sui petere debuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35822.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To demand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim at law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring an action to recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sue for</hi> any thing (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">postulo): causam dicere Prius unde petitur ... Quam ille qui petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per se litem contestatur, sibi soli petit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc Com. 18, 53</bibl></cit>: aliquando cum servis Habiti furti egit; <cit><quote lang="la">nuper ab ipso Habito petere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non calumniā litium alienos fundos, sed castris, exercitu, signis inferendis petebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi> (syn.: rogo, flagito, obsecro); constr with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. of pers.</hi> (cf. infra); ante- and postclass., with <hi rend="ital">acc. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos volo, vos peto atque obsecro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; freq. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te etiam atque etiam peto atque contendo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peto quaesoque, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peto igitur a te, vel, si pateris, oro, ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere in beneficii loco et gratiae, ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 3, 82, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere precibus per litteras ab aliquo, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam nocenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petito, ut intrare urbem liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Also, with <hi rend="ital">id</hi> or <hi rend="ital">illud</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, etc.: illud autem te peto, ut, etc., Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arma umeris arcumque animosa petebat Ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 352</bibl></cit>; cf.: cum <cb n="PETR" /> peteret (solum) donari quasi proprio suo deo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 5</bibl>: petit aes sibi dari <foreign lang="greek">eis a)/rtous</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl>.—De aliquo (for ab aliquo), <hi rend="ital">to beg</hi> or <hi rend="ital">request of one</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si de me petisses, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—Ab aliquo aliquid alicui, <hi rend="ital">to beg a thing of one person for another</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">M. Curtio tribunatum a Caesare petivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: ab aliquo pro aliquo petere, <hi rend="ital">to intercede for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eorum studiis, qui a te pro Ligario petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 10, 31</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. pers.</hi> (v. infra d.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum petit litteris, ut ad Britanniam proficisceretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 24</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="dom">Polit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solicit for an office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be a candidate for office</hi> (different from ambire, to go about among the people to collect their votes, to canvass, which took place after the petitio): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est ex iis, qui nunc petunt, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.13" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To solicit</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to seek to possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to woo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidine sic accensa (Sempronia) ut viros saepius peteret quam peteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te tam multi peterent, tu me una petisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosam quisque petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi illam petiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 478</bibl></cit>; cf.: quae tuus Vir petet, cave, ne neges; <cit><quote lang="la">Ne petitum aliunde eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 151</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.14" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To endeavor to obtain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive after</hi> any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugā salutem petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis profusio vel fortuita vel petita,</quote> <trans><tr>intentional</tr>, <tr>designed</tr>, <tr>produced by artificial means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victricemque petunt dextrae conjungere dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 421</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 571</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubiis natam sociare Latinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem transfigere ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:51:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 51, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the case of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hostibus victoriam petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium ex se, non victoriam peti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium ex victis hostibus populum Romanum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.15" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To fetch</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">qui argentum petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum e flammā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Eun, 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius initium rei demonstrandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid a Graecis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a litteris exiguam doloris oblivionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to obtain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspirium alte,</quote> <trans><tr>to fetch a deep sigh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latere petitus imo spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus alto de corde petiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ex veteri memoriā petita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.16" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betake one's self to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">iter a Vibone Brundisium terrā petere contendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversas vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:91" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium cursum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take another route</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam in partem petebant fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>betook themselves to flight</tr>, <tr>fled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35822.17" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To refer to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate to</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Trojanos haec monstra petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petoritum: <entryFree id="n35823" type="foreign" key="pe^to_ri^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtōrĭtum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtorrĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Celtic petor, four, and rit, wheel</etym>, <sense id="n35823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four -  wheeled carriage</hi>, of Gallic origin: petoritum et Gallicum vehiculum esse, et nomen ejus dictum existimant a numero quattuor rotarum: alii Osce, quod hi quoque petora quattuor vocent: alii Graece, sed <foreign lang="greek">aiolikw=s</foreign> dictum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 104</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petosiris: <entryFree id="n35824" type="main" key="Pe^to^si_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtŏsīris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peto/siris</foreign>, <sense id="n35824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Egyptian mathematician and astrologer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl>; Firm. Math. 4, praef.—Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a great mathematician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astrologer</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:580" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 580</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petovio: <entryFree id="n35825" type="main" key="Petovi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petovĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poetovĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Pannonia</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Pettau</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3592</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petra: <entryFree id="n35826" type="greek" key="pe_^tra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/tra</foreign>, <sense id="n35826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone</hi> (pure Lat. saxum; cf.: rupes, scopulus): petrarum genera sunt duo, quorum alterum naturale saxum prominens in mare; <cit><quote lang="la">alterum manufactum ut docet Aelius Gallus: Petra est, qui locus dextrā ac sinistrā fornicem expletur usque ad libramentum summi fornicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206</bibl></cit> Müll. (of the latter signif. there is no other example known): petris ingentibus tecta, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. (Ann. v. 366); Sen. Herc. Oet. <cb n="PETR" /> 804: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam de petrā produxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:48:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 48, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaviae in petris nidificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 32, 48, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alga, quae juxta terram in petris nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 6, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:117" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 12, 29, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35827" type="main" key="Pe_^tra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/tra</foreign>, <sense id="n35827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35827.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Arabia Petrœa</hi>, now the ruins of <hi rend="ital">Wadi Musa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:48:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 48, 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35827.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^traeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Petrean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 46, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hypericon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35827.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Pieria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35827.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35827.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi> Petra Pertusa, now <hi rend="ital">Il Furlo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epist. in Vespas. 17" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epist. in Vespas. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35827.6" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hill near Dyrrachium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35828" type="main" key="Petra3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrabulum: <entryFree id="n35829" type="gloss" key="petra^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrăbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">petro/bolon</foreign>, <sense id="n35829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone-thrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catapult</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petraeus: <entryFree id="n35830" type="greek" key="petraeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">petrai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that grows among rocks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rock-</hi> (post-Aug.) brassica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n35831" type="main" key="Pe^traeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕtraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Petra, I. B.</entryFree>
petralis: <entryFree id="n35832" type="main" key="petra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>petra</etym>, <sense id="n35832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stony</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 39, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petreius: <entryFree id="n35833" type="main" key="Petre_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrēĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. —So, esp, <hi rend="ital">a lieutenant of Pompey in the civil war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 2, 3</bibl>. He is probably the same person with <hi rend="ital">M. Petrejus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lieutenant of the consul C. Antonius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who defeated the followers of Catiline at Fœsulœ</hi>, A. U. C. 692; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35833.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Petreian;</hi> here prob. belongs: petreia vocabatur, quae pompam praecedens in coloniis aut municipiis imitabatur anum ebriam, ab agri vitio, scilicet petris, appellata, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243, 5</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242, 14</bibl> ib.—</sense><sense id="n35833.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrēiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Petreius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Petreian</hi>: auxilium, Auct. B. Afr. 19.</sense></entryFree>
petrenses: <entryFree id="n35834" type="main" key="Petrenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of Petra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Sicily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrensis: <entryFree id="n35835" type="main" key="petrensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. petra</etym>, <sense id="n35835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">found among rocks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stones</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petreus: <entryFree id="n35836" type="main" key="Petre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. petra or Petrus</etym>, <sense id="n35836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Petrean</hi> (eccl. Lat.): istae spinae, Petra et Petro transeunte, petreis pedibus tritae sunt, <hi rend="ital">of rock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Apostle Peter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 297:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 297, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
petrini: <entryFree id="n35837" type="main" key="Petri_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of Petra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Petreans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 39, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrinum: <entryFree id="n35838" type="main" key="Petri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a villa near Sinuessa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrinus: <entryFree id="n35839" type="greek" key="petri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/trinos</foreign>, <sense id="n35839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone-</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petrites: <entryFree id="n35840" type="greek" key="petri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">petri/ths</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <sense id="n35840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, perh. from the city of Petra, in Arabia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petro: <entryFree id="n35841" type="main" key="pe_^tro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pē^tro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. petra</etym>. <sense id="n35841.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rustic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrones rustici fere dicuntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206:23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206, 23</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: petrones rustici a petrarum asperitate et duritiā dicti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=207:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 207, 6</bibl> ib.—</sense><sense id="n35841.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An old wether</hi>, whose flesh is as hard as a stone (anteclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35842" type="main" key="Petro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. petra</etym>, <sense id="n35842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrocorii: <entryFree id="n35843" type="main" key="Petro^co^ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Petrŏcŏrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe in Aquitania</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Périgueux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, Inscr Maff. Mus. Ver 450, 8.</sense></entryFree>
petronia: <entryFree id="n35844" type="main" key="Pe_^tro_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^trōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Petronius.</entryFree>
petronianus: <entryFree id="n35845" type="main" key="Pe_^tro_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^trōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2. Petronius, B.</entryFree>
petronius: <entryFree id="n35846" type="main" key="pe_^tro_ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pē^trōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. petra</etym>, <sense id="n35846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rock-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crag-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mountain-</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35847" type="main" key="Pe_^tro_ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^trōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens.—So, esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">Petronius Arbiter,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman knight</tr>, <tr>a favorite of the emperor Nero</tr>, <tr>perh. the same person with Petronius</tr>, <tr>the author of a Latin romance which is preserved in a fragmentary state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^trōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the first wife of the emperor Vitellius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35847.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^trōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Petronius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Petronian</hi>: Petronia amnis est in Tiberim profluens, quam magistratus auspicato transeunt, cum in campo quid agere voluntquod<pb n="1366" /> <cb n="PEUM" />  genus auspicii peremne vocatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Petronia lex, respecting slaves: post legem Petroniam et senatusconsulta ad eam legem pertinentia, dominis, potestas ablata est ad bestias depugnandas suo arbitrio servos tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:11:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 11, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:1:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35847.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē^trōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Petronius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Petronian</hi>: Petroniana Albucia, Fulg. Myth. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
petroselinon: <entryFree id="n35848" type="greek" key="petro^se^li_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrŏsĕlīnon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-īnum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">petrose/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n35848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rock-parsley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 47, § 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrosus: <entryFree id="n35849" type="main" key="petro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">petrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. petra</etym>, <sense id="n35849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rocks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 50, § 96</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">petrōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rocky places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 29, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Laps. Virg. 7, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud cecidit super petrosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petrotos: <entryFree id="n35850" type="gloss" key="pe_^tro_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pē^trōtos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">petro/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n35850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petrified</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae modicos calices duos quos appellabant petrotos HS. V[dibreve]I=. venderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 195</bibl></cit> Jan. (dub.; al. pterotos).</sense></entryFree>
pettalus: <entryFree id="n35851" type="main" key="Petta^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pettălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mythic name of a hero who sought to attack Perseus at the court of Cepheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
petulans: <entryFree id="n35852" type="main" key="pe^tu^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prop. <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> of the obsol. petulo, from peto, qs. falling upon or assailing in jest, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n35852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saucy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freakish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petulant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35852.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: protervus, lascivus, procax): petulantes et petulci etiam appellantur, qui protervo impetu, et crebro petunt laedendi alterius gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effuse petulans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulans et furiosum genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:297" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 297</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 151</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatio petulantissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35852.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lascivious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si petulans fuisset in aliquā generosā nobili virgine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtŭlanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pertly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petulantly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem invehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulantissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petulantia: <entryFree id="n35853" type="main" key="pe^tu^lanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtŭlantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>petulans</etym>. <sense id="n35853.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sauciness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freakishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petulance</hi> (class.; syn. lascivia): itaque a petendo petulantia, a procando, id est poscendo, procacitas nominata est, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulantia et libido magis est adulescentium quam senum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulantia et audacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 35, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te non ulla meae laesit petulantia linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 37</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naevius ... cum ob assiduam maledicentiam et probra in principes civitatis ... in vincula conjectus esset ... in his fabulis, delicta sua et petulantias dictorum, quibus multos ante laeserat, diluisset,</quote> <trans><tr>insolent language</tr>, <tr>libels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35853.1" n="B" level="2"> In a milder sense, <hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35853.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35853.3" n="A" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">viciousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornuti fere perniciosi sunt propter petulantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35853.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">exuberance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxuriance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <trans><tr>violence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
petulcus: <entryFree id="n35854" type="main" key="pe^tulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕtulcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peto; cf. petulans <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n35854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">butting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt to butt</hi>, with the horns or head (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n35854.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caper velaries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35854.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">frisky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedi petulci dicti ab appetendo: unde et meretrices petulcas vocamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peuce: <entryFree id="n35855" type="greek" key="peuce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peu/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n35855.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The pinetree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitch-pine-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 35, 41, § 118</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35855.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 9, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35856" type="main" key="Peuce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Peucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n35856.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an island in the Danube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 202</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35856.1" n="II" level="1"> In mythology, <hi rend="ital">the wife of the Ister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:137" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:217" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peucedanum: <entryFree id="n35857" type="greek" key="peuce^da^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peucĕdănum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">peucĕdănos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peuke/danon</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">-os</foreign>, <sense id="n35857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant hog's-fennel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphurwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 70, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 919</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Graecis dicitur peucedanos: Latini pinastellum vocarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peucetia: <entryFree id="n35858" type="main" key="Peuce^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Peucĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 99</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35858.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Peucĕ-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peucetian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 513</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peumene: <entryFree id="n35859" type="greek" key="peume^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peumĕnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">peume/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n35859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scum of silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 108</bibl>. <cb n="PHAE" /></sense></entryFree>
pexatus: <entryFree id="n35860" type="main" key="pexa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pexātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pexus</etym>, <sense id="n35860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in a garment that has a nap on it</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pexatus pulcre rides mea, Zoile, trita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:58:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pexatus et gausapatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pexitas: <entryFree id="n35861" type="main" key="pexi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pexĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, perh. <sense id="n35861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closeness</hi> (post-Aug.); <cit><quote lang="la">of a spider's web: telae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
