pexsus: <entryFree id="n35862" type="main" key="Pexsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pexsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pexsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, v. <itype>pecto</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>
pexus: <entryFree id="n35863" type="main" key="pexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pecto.</entryFree>
pezicae: <entryFree id="n35864" type="greek" key="pezi^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pezĭcae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pezĭtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/zikes, pe/zeai</foreign>, <sense id="n35864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mushrooms without a root</hi> or <hi rend="ital">without a stalk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 14, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phacelinus: <entryFree id="n35865" type="main" key="Pha^ce^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăcĕlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Facelinus.</entryFree>
phacus: <entryFree id="n35866" type="main" key="Phacus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phacus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/kos</foreign>, <sense id="n35866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified place near Pella in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the treasury of the Macedonian kings was kept</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arx Phacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 46, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaeaces: <entryFree id="n35867" type="main" key="Phaea_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaeāces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai/akes</foreign>, <sense id="n35867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Phœacians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fabled luxurious inhabitants of the isle of Scheria</hi> (in historic times, Corcyra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 719</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 151</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phae-ax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Phœacian;</hi> transf., of a man in good case, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 24</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaeax populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35867.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaeācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faiaki/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Phœacians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the isle of Scheria</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Corcyra</hi>), <hi rend="ital">in the Ionian Sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corcyra Homero dicta Scheria et Phaeacia, Callimacho etiam Drepane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35867.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaeācis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faiaki/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Phœacian</hi>; <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaeācis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. Musa), <hi rend="ital">a poem on the sojourn of Ulysses in Phœacia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35867.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaeācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faia/kios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Phœacian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35867.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaeācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai/akos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Phœacian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 51.</sense></entryFree>
phaecasia: <entryFree id="n35868" type="main" key="phaeca^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaecăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. phaecasium.</entryFree>
phaecasiani: <entryFree id="n35869" type="main" key="phaeca^si^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaecăsĭāni dii</orth> <etym>phaecasium</etym>, <sense id="n35869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of deities</hi> of whom nothing further is known (perh. shod with phaecasia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 218</bibl> (al. phaecasiati).</sense></entryFree>
phaecasiatus: <entryFree id="n35870" type="main" key="phaeca^si^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaecăsĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shod with</hi> phaecasia: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae decent phaecasiatum palliatumque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a Grecian philosopher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaecasium: <entryFree id="n35871" type="greek" key="phaeca^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaecăsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">phaecă-sĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faika/sion</foreign>, <sense id="n35871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of white shoe</hi>, worn at Athens by the priests, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inauratae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaedo: <entryFree id="n35872" type="main" key="Phaedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaedo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaedon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai/dwn</foreign>, <sense id="n35872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disciple of Socrates and friend of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whom Plato has named his dialogue on the immortality of the soul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 25, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaedra: <entryFree id="n35873" type="main" key="Phaedra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaedra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai/dra</foreign>, <sense id="n35873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of king Minos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Ariadne and wife of Theseus; she slew herself for hopeless love of Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 511</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 434" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 434</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 47" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:243" default="NO">243</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaedrias: <entryFree id="n35874" type="main" key="Phaedri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaedrĭas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaedrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaedrus: <entryFree id="n35875" type="main" key="Phaedrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaedrus</orth> (<case>nom.</case> PHAEDER, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1111, 3</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai=dros</foreign>. <sense id="n35875.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pupil of Socrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Myrsinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whom Plato named one of his dialogues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:53 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 53 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n35875.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Epicurean philosopher of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instructor of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35875.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian by birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of some well-known Latin fables.</hi></sense></entryFree>
phaenion: <entryFree id="n35876" type="greek" key="phaeni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaenĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">faini/on</foreign>, <sense id="n35876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the anemone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 164</bibl> (al. phrenion, v. Sillig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
phaenomenon: <entryFree id="n35877" type="greek" key="phaeno^me^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaenŏmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">faino/menon</foreign>, <sense id="n35877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appearance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35877.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35877.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35877.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phaenŏmĕna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">faino/mena</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">appearances in the air</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sky</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35877.4" n="B" level="2"> Phaenomena, <hi rend="ital">the title of a poem by Aratus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
phaenon: <entryFree id="n35878" type="greek" key="Phaenon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaenon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai/nwn</foreign> (shining), <sense id="n35878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the planet Saturn</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae Stilbon volvat, quae secula Phaenon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 18, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 886</bibl>.—In the Gr. <case>acc.</case> Phaenona, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 851</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl>). <cb n="PHAL" /></sense></entryFree>
phaestum: <entryFree id="n35879" type="main" key="Phaestum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai=stos</foreign>. <sense id="n35879.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cortyna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by Minos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35879.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phae-stĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faistia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a female inhabitant of Phœstum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Phœstian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inter Phaestiadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 715</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35879.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phae-stĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fai/stios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phœstum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phœstian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35879.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Eurotas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35879.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Locris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaethon: <entryFree id="n35880" type="main" key="Pha^e^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăĕthon</orth> (dissyl.: fulmine Phaethon, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl>), <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fae/qwn</foreign> (the shining one). <sense id="n35880.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Helios and Clymene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having obtained from his father permission to drive the sun's chariot for a day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lost control of the steeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was struck down by a thunderbolt of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prevent his setting the earth on fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 76</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaëthontem orbi terrarum educare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:47 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 47 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35880.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of the sun</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35880.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăĕ-thontēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faeqo/nteios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phaëthon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phaëthontean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Padus (because Phaëthon is said to have fallen into the Padus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:12:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favilla, i. e. fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:221" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 221</bibl></cit>: umbra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the poplar</hi> (because the sisters of Phaëthon were changed into poplars), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:15:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35880.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăĕthontĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faeqontia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Phaëthontiad</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a sister of Phaëthon.</hi> They wept for their brother, and were changed into poplars (acc. to others, into alders), while their tears were converted into amber: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaëthontiadum silva sororum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 185" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 62</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 340</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n35880.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăĕthentis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faeqonti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, i. q. Phaëthontias, <hi rend="ital">a Phaëthontiad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sister of Phaëthon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 792</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phaëthon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phaëthontian</hi>: gutta, <hi rend="ital">amber</hi> (into which the tears of Phaëthon's sisters were said to be converted), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:32:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 32, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35880.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăĕthontĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faeqo/ntios</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n35880.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phaëthon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phaëthontian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis, i.e. Padus (v. Phaëthonteus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:149" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 149</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35880.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans><tr>the sun's disk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:110" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaethusa: <entryFree id="n35881" type="main" key="Pha^e^thu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăĕthūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fae/qousa</foreign> (the shining one), <sense id="n35881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sister of Phaëthon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phagedaena: <entryFree id="n35882" type="greek" key="pha^ge^daena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăgĕdaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fage/daina</foreign> (voracity). <sense id="n35882.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A diseased and excessive appetite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voracity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:3:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 3, 46</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 68, § 110</bibl>.—As a disease of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 10</bibl> (written as Greek).— Hence, </sense><sense id="n35882.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An eating ulcer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phagedaenicus: <entryFree id="n35883" type="greek" key="pha^ge^daeni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăgĕdaenĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fagedainiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spreading like a cancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">can-cerous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35883.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">suffering from cancers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancerous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phagedaenici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:3:47" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phager: <entryFree id="n35884" type="greek" key="pha^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pa-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">phăgrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pa-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/gros</foreign>, <sense id="n35884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:107" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 107</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:113" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 38, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phagita: <entryFree id="n35885" type="main" key="Pha^gi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăgīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">fa/gw</foreign>, to eat</etym>, <sense id="n35885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phago: <entryFree id="n35886" type="greek" key="pha^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăgo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/gos, fagw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizer</hi> (ante-and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">edones et phagones ab edacitate, unum Latinum, aliud Graecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 48, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. Non. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phagrus: <entryFree id="n35887" type="main" key="pha^grus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăgrus</orth>, v. phager.</entryFree>
phala: <entryFree id="n35888" type="main" key="pha^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. fala.</entryFree>
phalacrine: <entryFree id="n35889" type="main" key="Phalacri_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phalacrīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phalacrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the Sabine territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the emperor Vespasian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalacrocorax: <entryFree id="n35890" type="greek" key="pha^lacro^co^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălacrŏ-cŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">falakroko/rac</foreign>, <sense id="n35890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cormorant</hi> (pure Lat. corvus aquaticus): <cit><quote lang="la">phalacrocoraces, aves Balearium insularum peculiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalaecus: <entryFree id="n35891" type="main" key="Pha^laecus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălaecus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/laikos</foreign>, <sense id="n35891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient Greek poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whom a kind of verse is named</hi> Phalaecium, Phalaecum, or Phaleucium carmen. This verse is <hi rend="ital">hendecasyllabic</hi>, consisting of a spondee, a dactyl, and three trochees (e. g. vidi credite <pb n="1367" /> <cb n="PHAL" /> per lacus Lucrinos), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 509</bibl> P.; Terentian. p. 2440 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 517</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum Phalaecium, Mar. Victor. 2566 P.: carmen Phalaecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sat. 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n35891.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tyrant of Phocœa;</hi> whence <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phă-laecēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Phalœcean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Phalœcus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:504" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 504</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phalangae: <entryFree id="n35892" type="greek" key="pha^langae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangae</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălangae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/lagges</foreign>. <sense id="n35892.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a pole to carry burdens on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying-pole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium Afri contra Aegyptios primum fecere fustibus, quos vocant phalangas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 4, 8, § 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35892.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a wooden roller</hi>, to place under ships and military machines for the purpose of moving them along (class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 23 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
phalangarius: <entryFree id="n35893" type="main" key="pha^langa_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălangā-rĭus</orth> (in inscrr. also PALANCARIVS and FALANCARIVS), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>phalangae</etym>, <sense id="n35893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries burdens with the aid of a long pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 23 sq.</bibl> (v. phalanga); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 10</bibl>; Inscr. Giorn. Pisan. tom. 16, p. 192; Inscr. Marin. Atti, p. 151; Inscr. Kellerm. ap. Orell. Analect. Epigr. (Index Lection. Acad. Turic. Aestiv. 1838), p. 43, 4090.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35894" type="main" key="pha^langa_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>phalanx</etym>, <sense id="n35894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier belonging to a phalanx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a phalangary</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 50, 5</bibl> (cf. phalangitae).</sense></entryFree>
phalangion: <entryFree id="n35895" type="main" key="pha^langi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. phalangium.</entryFree>
phalangitae: <entryFree id="n35896" type="greek" key="pha^langi_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">falaggi=tai</foreign>, <sense id="n35896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers belonging to a phalanx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phalangites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalangites: <entryFree id="n35897" type="greek" key="pha^langi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">falaggi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n35897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spider-root</hi>: Anthericum liliastrum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 98, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalangium: <entryFree id="n35898" type="greek" key="pha^langi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (late collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">phălangĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 14, 6, 16</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">fala/ggion</foreign>. <sense id="n35898.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of venomous spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:79" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 24, 28, § 79</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35898.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Spider-root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anthericum</hi>, for phalangites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 98, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalango: <entryFree id="n35899" type="spur" key="pha^lango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălango</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălango</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>phalanga</etym>, <sense id="n35899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry away on a pole</hi> (anteclass.), Afran. ap. Perotti Cornucop. ad Epigr. 115. The passage is otherwise unknown.</sense></entryFree>
phalannaeus: <entryFree id="n35900" type="main" key="Phalannaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phalannaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phalanna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phalannœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phalantus: <entryFree id="n35901" type="main" key="Pha^lantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălantus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/lantos</foreign>, <sense id="n35901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Spartan who emigrated to Italy and there founded Tarentum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et regnata petam Laconi Rura Phalanto,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Tarentum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35901.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phă-lantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phalantean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalanteum Tarentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:16" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35901.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phă-lantīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phalantine</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Tarentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalantinus Galesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35901.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălanthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">poetic name for the city of Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalanx: <entryFree id="n35902" type="main" key="pha^lanx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălanx</orth> (post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">fălanx</orth>), <itype>angis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/lagc</foreign>. <sense id="n35902.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n35902.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a band of soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a host</hi> drawn up in close order (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemnoniae phalanges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tuscorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animosa (said of eight brothers fighting together),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctae umbone phalanges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35902.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a host</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">culparum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 816</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35902.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35902.4" n="A" level="2"> Among the Athenians and Spartans, <hi rend="ital">a division of an army drawn up in battle array</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a battalion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phalanx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pelop. 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35902.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Macedonian order of battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Macedonian phalanx</hi> (a compact parallelogram of fifty men abreast and sixteen deep), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (cohortes) cuneum Macedonum (phalangem ipsi vocant) perrumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerat et falangem triginta milium hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 50, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35902.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An order of battle of the Gauls and Germans</hi>, forming a parallelogram: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii confertissimā acie, phalange factā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalangem perfringere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phalara: <entryFree id="n35903" type="main" key="Pha^la^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/lara</foreign>, <sense id="n35903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor of Phthiotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Sinus Maliacus, now <hi rend="ital">Stillida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalarica: <entryFree id="n35904" type="main" key="pha^la_ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălārĭca</orth>, v falarica. <cb n="PHAN" /></entryFree>
phalaris: <entryFree id="n35905" type="main" key="pha^la^ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălăris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">phălēris</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">falari/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">falhri/s</foreign>. <sense id="n35905.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant canarygrass</hi> (Phalaris canariensis, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 102, § 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35905.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A water-hen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 67, § 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35906" type="main" key="Pha^la^ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Phalarin, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 186</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/laris</foreign>, <sense id="n35906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tyrant of Agrigentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for whom Perillus made a brazen bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which those condemned by him were to be roasted alive. He caused Perillus to be the first to suffer by it</hi> (v. Perillus), <hi rend="ital">but afterwards experienced the same punishment himself at the hands of his exasperated subjects</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 653</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:211" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalasarneus: <entryFree id="n35907" type="main" key="Phalasarne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phalasarnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falasarnei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Cretan city of Phalasarne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phalasarnean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalerae: <entryFree id="n35908" type="greek" key="pha^le^rae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălĕrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<sense id="n35908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> phalera posita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>; Jan. phaleras), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ fa/lara</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n35908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35908.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining ornament for the breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a metal disc</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boss</hi>, worn by men, esp. as a military decoration: <cit><quote lang="la">phalerae sunt belli ornamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 554, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 29</bibl>: phaleris et torque aliquem donare <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaleras deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaleris hic pectora fulget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 255</bibl></cit>.—As a military mark of distinction: <cit><quote lang="la">equites donati phaleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 458</bibl> Heyn. and Wagn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 60</bibl>.—Worn by women: matrona ornata phaleris pelagiis, P. Syrus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35908.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trapping for the forehead and breast of horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus equum phaleris insignem victor habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 310</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 103</bibl>.—As a trapping for elephants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35908.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an external ornament</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decoration</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): ad populum phaleras! <hi rend="ital">trappings for the people!</hi> who allow themselves to be deceived by externals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 30</bibl>.—Of rhetorical ornament, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
phalereus: <entryFree id="n35909" type="main" key="Pha^le_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălēreus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phalerum.</entryFree>
phaleris: <entryFree id="n35910" type="main" key="pha^le_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălēris</orth>, v. 1. phalaris.</entryFree>
phalero: <entryFree id="n35911" type="main" key="pha^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>phalerae</etym>, <sense id="n35911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adorn with trappings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament the breast</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia phalerari sibi magis quam nodari gaudent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—Fig., <hi rend="ital">to deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae phalerandae gratiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. Min. 1, 12, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">phălĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">I</orth>. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wearing an ornament for the forehead and breast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba Mazacum atque cursorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35911.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">decorated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi>: phaleratis dictis aliquem ducere, <hi rend="ital">with fine speeches</hi>, Ter Phorm. 3, 2, 16.</sense></entryFree>
phalerum: <entryFree id="n35912" type="main" key="Pha^le_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falhro/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the oldest harbor of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connected with the city by a long wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a demos of the same name belonging to it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n35912.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălēreus</orth> (mostly trisyl.), ĕi and <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falhreu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Phalerum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Phalerian</hi>: Demetrius Phalereus, or simply Phalereus, <hi rend="ital">a ruler of Athens and a famous orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> B. C. 300, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 4</bibl>.—Scanned as a quadrisyllable: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius, qui dictus est Phalereus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:80" default="NO">10, 1, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35912.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falhriko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Phalerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. portus), = Phalerum, in Phalericum descendere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Phalerico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaleucius: <entryFree id="n35913" type="main" key="Pha^leuci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăleucĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phalaecus.</entryFree>
phaliscus: <entryFree id="n35914" type="main" key="Phaliscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaliscus</orth>, v. Faliscus.</entryFree>
phallovitrobolus: <entryFree id="n35915" type="main" key="phallovitrobo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phallovitrobŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vitro-bŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel shaped like a phallus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 8, 5</bibl> dub. (Momms. vitro, fundibuli).</sense></entryFree>
phallus: <entryFree id="n35916" type="greek" key="phallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fallo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of an obscene shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carried about at the festival of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally a symbol of the generative power of nature; a phallus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 176</bibl>; cf. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 21.</sense></entryFree>
phanae: <entryFree id="n35917" type="main" key="Pha^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fanai/</foreign>, <sense id="n35917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor and promontory in the isle of Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted</hi> <cb n="PHAR" /> <hi rend="ital">for its wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43, 11</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35917.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phanœan</hi>: rex Phanaeus, <hi rend="ital">the king of Phanœ</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">Phanœan wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phanerosis: <entryFree id="n35918" type="greek" key="pha^ne^ro_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phănĕrōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fane/rwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n35918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manifestation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revelation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phanote: <entryFree id="n35919" type="main" key="Pha^no^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănŏtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănŏtēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fano/th, *fano/teia</foreign>, <sense id="n35919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35919.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a castle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35919.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Panope, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasia: <entryFree id="n35920" type="greek" key="phanta^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fantasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nicetas longe disertius hanc phantasiam movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor tuum phantasias patitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 34, 6</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach: phantasia, non homo, <hi rend="ital">a mere notion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mere semblance of a man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 8 al.</bibl>, written as Greek, and translated visum).— </sense><sense id="n35920.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A phantom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) colli-git visa nocturna, quas phantasias nos adpellamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasma: <entryFree id="n35921" type="greek" key="phantasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/ntasma</foreign>. <sense id="n35921.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An apparition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantom</hi> (postAug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">idolon, imago, simulacrum): velim scire, esse phantasmata et habere figuram ... an inania, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si phantasma fuit Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 6, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35921.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantasm</hi> of an object (late Lat. for visum, imago, species): <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandriam cum eloqui volo, quam nunquam vidi, praesto est apud me phantasma ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trinit. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trinit. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasmaticus: <entryFree id="n35922" type="main" key="phantasma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantasmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>phantasma</etym>, <sense id="n35922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fantastic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasos: <entryFree id="n35923" type="main" key="Phanta^sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phantăsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/ntasos</foreign>, <sense id="n35923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Somnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantastice: <entryFree id="n35924" type="main" key="phantasti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantastĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by the fancy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Nebrid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasticus: <entryFree id="n35925" type="greek" key="phantasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fantastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaon: <entryFree id="n35926" type="main" key="Pha^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n35926.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A youth of Lesbos beloved by Sappho without return</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:35:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 35, 18</bibl>.—As a prov. of coldness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35926.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a freedman of the emperor Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl> and 49.</sense></entryFree>
pharaeus: <entryFree id="n35927" type="main" key="Pha^raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Pharœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:163" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pharanitis: <entryFree id="n35928" type="main" key="pha_rani_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phāranītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pharanitis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of amethyst</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharao: <entryFree id="n35929" type="main" key="Pha^ra^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărăo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faraw/</foreign> (Hebrew <foreign />), <sense id="n35929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pharaoh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of the Egyptian kings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharao nomen est non hominis, sed honoris, sicut apud nos Augusti appellantur reges, cum propriis nominibus censeantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 15</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
pharetra: <entryFree id="n35930" type="greek" key="pha^re_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phărē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fare/tra</foreign>. <sense id="n35930.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a quiver</hi> for holding arrows (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam pharetrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec venenatis gravida sagittis, Fusce, pharetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to undo</tr>, <tr>open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatricis puellae (Dianae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pharetrā suā abscondit me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 49, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:607" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 607</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:259 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 259 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n35930.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sundial in the form of a quiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharetratus: <entryFree id="n35931" type="main" key="pha^re_^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phărē^trātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pharetra</etym>, <sense id="n35931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing a quiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quivered</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pharetrata Camilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semiramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pharetrazonium: <entryFree id="n35932" type="gloss" key="pha^retrazo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăretra-zōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quiverbelt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharetriger: <entryFree id="n35933" type="main" key="pha^re_^tri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phărē^trĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pharetragero</etym>, <sense id="n35933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quiver-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): clade pharetrigeri regis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the Persian king Xerxes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:286" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 286</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pharia: <entryFree id="n35934" type="main" key="Pha^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭa ūva</orth>, <sense id="n35934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape in the neighborhood of Pisa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phariacus: <entryFree id="n35935" type="main" key="Pha^ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pharus, A.</entryFree>
pharicon: <entryFree id="n35936" type="greek" key="pha_ri^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phārĭcon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fariko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so named from its inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 41, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharis: <entryFree id="n35937" type="main" key="Pha_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa=ris</foreign>, <sense id="n35937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Messenia</hi>,<pb n="1368" /> <cb n="PHAR" />  <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Pharae or Pherae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:226" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharisaeus: <entryFree id="n35938" type="main" key="Pha^ri^saeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pharisee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the Jewish sect</hi> of that name, usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsaei</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharīsaei</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 574</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisai=oi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Pharisees</hi>, a Jewish sect (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 2, 16</bibl> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum legem Pharisaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35938.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Pharisœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35938.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisaiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Pharisaic</hi>: sepulcra, Hier. adv. Vigil. n. 9.</sense></entryFree>
pharitae: <entryFree id="n35939" type="main" key="Pha^ri_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pharus, C. and B.</entryFree>
pharmaceuticus: <entryFree id="n35940" type="greek" key="pharma^ceuti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăceutĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">farmakeutiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to drugs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pharmaceutical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:126" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmaceutria: <entryFree id="n35941" type="greek" key="pharma^ceutri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăceutrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farmakeu/tria</foreign>, <sense id="n35941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sorceress</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmacopola: <entryFree id="n35942" type="greek" key="pharma^co^po_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăcŏpōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farmakopw/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n35942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vender of medicines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quack</hi> (class.), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumforaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmacus: <entryFree id="n35943" type="greek" key="pharma^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farmako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poisoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sorcerer</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmacusa: <entryFree id="n35944" type="main" key="Pharma^cu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharmăcūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farmakou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n35944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south-west from Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Cœsar was taken by pirates</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Farmako</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharnabazus: <entryFree id="n35945" type="main" key="Pharna^ba_zus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharnăbāzus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farna/bazos</foreign>, <sense id="n35945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pharnabazus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Persian satrap under Darius Nothus and Artaxerxes</hi>, 412 to 377 B.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:1 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pharnaceon: <entryFree id="n35946" type="greek" key="pharna^ce_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharnăcēon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pharnacion.</entryFree>
pharnaces: <entryFree id="n35947" type="main" key="Pharna^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharnăces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farna/khs</foreign>. <sense id="n35947.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of two kings of Pontus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35947.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grandfather of Mithridates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 151</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35947.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Mithridates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeated by Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 476</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35947.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a slave of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 44, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharnacion: <entryFree id="n35948" type="main" key="pharna^ci_o^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharnăcīŏn</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ēon</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farna/keion</foreign>, <sense id="n35948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant panax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named for Pharnaces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 14, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharnuprium: <entryFree id="n35949" type="main" key="pharnuprium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharnuprium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of figwine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 102</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
pharos: <entryFree id="n35950" type="main" key="Pha^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Pharus.</entryFree>
pharsalos: <entryFree id="n35951" type="main" key="Pharsa_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/rsalos</foreign>, <sense id="n35951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Cœsar defeated Pompey</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fersala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:23" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 350</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35951.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pharsalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharsalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>Cœsar's victory over Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 823</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35951.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pharsalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Cœsar defeated Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 8, 23</bibl></cit> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 37</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region about Pharsalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 823</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:50 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 50 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35951.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An epic poem by Lucan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:985" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 985</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
